original: @1b # // de'i 'og tu mthar thug pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: @1b # // de'i 'og tu mthar thug pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the skill in concluding the collection should be explained, such as the meaning of the words, etc.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi grangs kyi mtha' rnam pa drug tu thug par bsdu ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi grangs kyi mtha' rnam pa drug tu thug par bsdu ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as the skill in concluding the collection of the six perfections in six aspects.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: Therefore, he asks, Blessed One, why should those bases of training be known as designated in six aspects?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: For two reasons:üîΩfor the sake of benefiting sentient beings and for the sake of countering the afflictions.

original: sems can la phan dgags pa dang ; nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba nyid kyi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can la phan dgags pa dang ; nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba nyid kyi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: For the sake of maturing external sentient beings and for the sake of maturing one's own buddha qualities, respectively.

original: de la gsum ni sems can la phan gdags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang // bzod pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la gsum ni sems can la phan gdags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang // bzod pa gsum ste /
translated: Three of them are for the benefit of sentient beings.üîΩ Generosity, morality, and patience are for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de yang phan pa nye bar sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa dang ; phas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan 'dogs pa go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang phan pa nye bar sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa dang ; phas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan 'dogs pa go rims bzhin te /
translated: They are for the benefit of sentient beings because they respectively benefit by providing material needs, by not harming, and by tolerating harm.

original: de tsam gyis ni pha rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni pha rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings are matured by just these perfections.

original: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya @2a * //
analyzed: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya @2a * //
translated: Three should be known as the antidotes to the addictions.

original: ste zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab gsum ste /
analyzed: ste zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab gsum ste /
translated: Vigor, meditative concentration, and wisdom are the antidotes to the addictions.

original: de yang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / bag la nyal legs par 'joms pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / bag la nyal legs par 'joms pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin te /
translated: They are antidotes to the addictions because they respectively apply to the side of virtue, overpower the addictions, and thoroughly crush their instinctual natures.

original: de tsam gyis na bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one's own Buddha-qualities are matured by just that much.

original: de la phan pa nye bar sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa ni yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de la phan pa nye bar sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa ni yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Therein, assistance through the performance of benefit is shown by the statement: ‚ÄúHe assists by the performance of benefit through the provision of necessities.‚Äù

original: gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa ni /
translated: Assistance through the non-performance of injury is shown by the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúHe assists by the performance of benefit through the non-performance of injury, through morality.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar mi sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar mi sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Assistance through the tolerance of injury by others is shown by the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúHe assists by the performance of benefit through the tolerance of injury, through patience.‚ÄùüîΩAssistance through the performance of benefit is shown by the statement:

original: phas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan 'dogs pa ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / tho 'tshams pa la ji mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: phas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan 'dogs pa ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / tho 'tshams pa la ji mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe assists by the performance of benefit through the performance of benefit, through effort.‚Äù

original: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas ni de tsam gyis na phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so zhes bya bas ni de tsam gyis na phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By just that much, external sentient beings are brought to full maturity.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: Application as the antidote to the afflictions through the side of virtue is

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom @2b pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom @2b pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: taught by diligence one applies oneself to the collection that completely conquers and thoroughly conquers the afflictions.

original: rnam par gnon pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: rnam par gnon pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: Application as the antidote to the afflictions through complete victory is

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: taught by concentration one completely conquers the afflictions.

original: bag la nyal legs par 'joms pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: bag la nyal legs par 'joms pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: Application as the antidote to the afflictions through thoroughly destroying latent states is

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: taught by wisdom one thoroughly destroys latent states.

original: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis na bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis na bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These three are the antidotes to the afflictions, because by just that much, one's own Buddha qualities are fully matured.

original: mthar thug pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mthar thug pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The summary of the ultimate has been explained in terms of the meaning of the words and so on.

original: // / de'i 'og tu grogs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu grogs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of skill in friends should be explained.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: One should be skilled in the four perfections.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: Therefore, it is asked, Blessed One, why should the other perfections be designated as four?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni thabs la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum gyi grogs yin la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni thabs la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum gyi grogs yin la /
translated: Because they are the very companions of those six perfections. Skill in means is the companion of the three: giving, morality, and patience.

original: smon lam ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs yin /
analyzed: smon lam ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs yin /
translated: Vow is the companion of effort.

original: stobs ni bsam gtan gyi grogs yin /
analyzed: stobs ni bsam gtan gyi grogs yin /
translated: Power is the companion of meditative stabilization.

original: ye shes ni shes rab kyi grogs yin pas /
analyzed: ye shes ni shes rab kyi grogs yin pas /
translated: Wisdom is the companion of wisdom.

original: grogs kyi grangs kyang bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: grogs kyi grangs kyang bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the number of companions should be understood as four.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum gyis phan pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pa dang /üîΩphas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan btags nas so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i dge ba la 'jog par byed de zhes bya bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su zin pa ni thabs la mkhas pa
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum gyis phan pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / gnod pa nye bar mi sgrub pa dang / phas kyi gnod pa dang du len pas phan btags nas so // byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i dge ba la 'jog par byed de zhes bya bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su zin pa ni thabs la mkhas pa
translated: Therein, since sentient beings are helped by three perfections, i.e., by the three of giving, morality, and patience, they are helped by the establishment of benefit and the non-establishment of harm.üîΩSince they are helped by the acceptance of harm, the bodhisattvas establish them in the virtue of skill in means which is conjoined with the means of attraction.

original: yin par ston to //
analyzed: yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that the activity of body, speech, and mind of the bodhisattvas, conjoined with the four means of attraction, is skill in means.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams gdul ba dang / bsdu ba'i thabs ni rnams pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams gdul ba dang / bsdu ba'i thabs ni rnams pa bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, the means of conversion and collection of sentient beings is fourfold.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / @3a * //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / @3a * //
translated: It is helpful, it causes to take up, it causes to enter,

original: mthun par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par sgrub pa'o //
translated: and it causes to accomplish the concordant.

original: des bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas phan 'dogs pas thabs yin te /
analyzed: des bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas phan 'dogs pas thabs yin te /
translated: The means of conversion is helpful because it helps through giving.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa sna tshogs kyis phan btags na sems can rnams de'i tshig mnyan pa dang / bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa sna tshogs kyis phan btags na sems can rnams de'i tshig mnyan pa dang / bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one helps through various kinds of material giving, sentient beings will listen to his words and will think of doing them.

original: snyan par smra ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pas thabs yin te /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pas thabs yin te /
translated: Pleasant speech is the means of conversion because it causes to take up.

original: sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa rnams kyi de dang de la kun tu rmongs pa ma lus par bsal ba'i phyir rig pa 'dzin du bcug na kun tu rmongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa rnams kyi de dang de la kun tu rmongs pa ma lus par bsal ba'i phyir rig pa 'dzin du bcug na kun tu rmongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one causes to take up the knowledge that completely removes all the confusions of those who are helped through giving, then they will become free from all confusions.

original: don spyod pa ni 'jug par byed pas thabs yin te /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni 'jug par byed pas thabs yin te /
translated: Helpful activity is the means of conversion because it causes to enter.

original: rig pa 'dzin du bcug pa rnams kyi dge ba'i gnas kyis bslang ste /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin du bcug pa rnams kyi dge ba'i gnas kyis bslang ste /
translated: and those who are made to take up the awareness mantra are inspired by the virtuous qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: dge ba'i gnas su btsud na dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su btsud na dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And when they are inspired, they become disciplined.

original: don mthun pa ni mthun par sgrub pas thabs yin te /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni mthun par sgrub pas thabs yin te /
translated: Concordant deeds are the means of establishing concord.üîΩWhen they are inspired in this way, the disciples will not say to the bodhisattvas, You yourself are not yet endowed with faith, moral discipline, generosity, and wisdom, so why do you make others take them up?

original: de ltar btsud pa rnams de las khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab dang ldan pa ma yin na ci'i phyir khyod gzhan dag de yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed ces gdul ba dag de la smra bar mi 'gyur bas des bdag nyid kyang don mthun par sgrub na gzhan dag gdul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar btsud pa rnams de las khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab dang ldan pa ma yin na ci'i phyir khyod gzhan dag de yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed ces gdul ba dag de la smra bar mi 'gyur bas des bdag nyid kyang don mthun par sgrub na gzhan dag gdul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, if the bodhisattvas themselves practice concordant deeds, they will be able to discipline others.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po thams cad dam /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po thams cad dam /
translated: Thus, the four ways of attracting disciples are the means of gathering disciples for the bodhisattvas' physical, verbal, and mental activities.

original: re res zin pa des ni thabs la mkhas pa yin pas sngar pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis phan btags nas de'i thabs la mkhas pa des dge ba la 'jog par byed pas /
analyzed: re res zin pa des ni thabs la mkhas pa yin pas sngar pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis phan btags nas de'i thabs la mkhas pa des dge ba la 'jog par byed pas /
translated: Since each of these is a skillful means, after previously benefiting with the three perfections, that skillful means causes one to be established in virtue.

original: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po dag gi grogs su 'gyur ba yin par yongs su ston to zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po dag gi grogs su 'gyur ba yin par yongs su ston to zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, I teach that the perfection of skillful means is the companion of the three perfections.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu bsgom mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu bsgom mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: If a bodhisattva is unable to always cultivate the perfections due to having many afflictions in this very life, this is the counteragent to the perfection of effort.

original: mos pa dman pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mos pa dman pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: If one is unable to settle the mind inwardly due to having a weak superior intention because of having a weak aspiration, this is the counteragent to the perfection of concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par @3b sgrub mi nus pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te mi mthun
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par @3b sgrub mi nus pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te mi mthun
translated: The antithesis of the perfection of wisdom is the inability to accomplish supramundane wisdom because of not having cultivated meditative concentration on the object of observation that is attained in the bodhisattva collection.

original: pa'i phyogs de gsum spong zhing pha rol tu phyin pa de gsum gyi grogs su pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gsum rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyogs de gsum spong zhing pha rol tu phyin pa de gsum gyi grogs su pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gsum rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The other three perfections are applied in order to abandon those three antitheses and to assist those three perfections.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad smras pa de spong zhing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad smras pa de spong zhing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
translated: The antithesis of the perfection of effort is as stated. Abandoning that, the assistance of the perfection of effort is

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par blangs te /
translated: taking up the accumulation of merit

original: gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed /
analyzed: gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed /
translated: and mentally aspiring to have little affliction in the future.

original: de ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That is the perfection of aspiration.

original: de la nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Since one has few afflictions and is able to undertake effort, the perfection of vows becomes the companion of the perfection of effort.

original: gong nas gong du ye shes khyad par can don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gong nas gong du ye shes khyad par can don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of vows is the pursuit of special wisdom in higher and higher states.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad bstan pa de spong zhing /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad bstan pa de spong zhing /
translated: The avoidance of the discordances with the perfection of meditative stabilization, as they have been presented,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
translated: and the support for the perfection of meditative stabilization

original: des skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas /
analyzed: des skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas /
translated: are the reliance on holy persons and the reliance on listening to the holy Dharma.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par rtog pa na khams gya nom pa las bsam pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par rtog pa na khams gya nom pa las bsam pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: From that, one attains proper mental activity and, when one has weak resolve, one attains the power of resolve from the excellent constituent.

original: de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Its strength is the perfection of strength.

original: des sems nang du 'jog nus pa yin pas de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs zhes bya bas bstan te //
analyzed: des sems nang du 'jog nus pa yin pas de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs zhes bya bas bstan te //
translated: Since it is able to settle the mind inwardly, its strength is the perfection of concentration.

original: bdud thams cad kyis lam mi chod pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis lam mi chod pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of strength is the non-interruption of the path by all demons.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad bstan pa de spong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji skad bstan pa de spong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs ni /
translated: The abandonment of the resistances to the perfection of wisdom as they have been taught, and the assistance to the perfection of wisdom,üîΩare the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgom pa la bsam gtan byed de /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgom pa la bsam gtan byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva practices concentration in the cultivation of the object of the attainment of the bodhisattva canon.

original: de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That is his perfection of wisdom.

original: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir des ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya bas bstan te /üîΩde la shes rab ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab @4a * //
analyzed: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir des ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya bas bstan te / de la shes rab ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab @4a * //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of knowledge, which is the companion of wisdom.

original: tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin /
analyzed: tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin /
translated: Here, wisdom is the aspect of the differentiation of general and specific characteristics.

original: ye shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge is the aspect of the differentiation of the engagement of cause and effect.

original: yang gcig tu na shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin /
translated: Moreover, wisdom is the aspect of apprehending ultimate truth.

original: ye shes ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no //üîΩgrogs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ye shes ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no // grogs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: Knowledge is the aspect of apprehending conventional truth.üîΩThe meaning of the words of the expertise in the aggregates and so on have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words of the expertise in the elements and so on will be explained.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i go rims la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i go rims la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as the order in which the six perfections arise, one from the other.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rims de ltar bstan par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rims de ltar bstan par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord has been asked, ‚ÄúWhy should the order of these six perfections be taught in that way?‚ÄùüîΩThen, it is because of the basis on which they are accomplished.

original: de nas gang du 'grub pa'i rten gyis yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni go rims kyi tshul rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de nas gang du 'grub pa'i rten gyis yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni go rims kyi tshul rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three modes of order:

original: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma 'byung ba dang / snga ma dman pa yin la /üîΩphyi ma dam pa yin pa dang / snga ma rags pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma 'byung ba dang / snga ma dman pa yin la / phyi ma dam pa yin pa dang / snga ma rags pa yin la /
translated: the later ones arise in dependence on the earlier ones;üîΩthe earlier ones are inferior and the later ones are superior;

original: phyi ma phra ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi ma phra ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: the earlier ones are gross and the later ones are subtle.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lus dang / longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lus dang / longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúwhen the bodhisattva does not care about body and possessions, he undertakes morality,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the terms and so on, for the skill in the elements, has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu tha dad pa la rab tu dbye ba mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu tha dad pa la rab tu dbye ba mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the terms and so on, for the skill in the differentiation of the various kinds, should be explained.

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re yang rnam pa gsum gsum du tha dad pa'i rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re yang rnam pa gsum gsum du tha dad pa'i rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, each of the six perfections should be known as having three kinds of differentiation.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rnam pa du mar rab tu dbye ba lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rnam pa du mar rab tu dbye ba lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is asked, ‚ÄúHow many kinds of differentiation are there of those perfections?‚Äù

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni drug po re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum du rab tu dbye'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni drug po re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum du rab tu dbye'o //
translated: The three kinds means that each of the six is differentiated into three kinds.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are three kinds of generosity.

original: chos sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The generosity of the Dharma is also threefold:

original: glegs bam sbyin pa dang / gzhung bzhin 'chad pa dang / mkhan por ston pa'o //
analyzed: glegs bam sbyin pa dang / gzhung bzhin 'chad pa dang / mkhan por ston pa'o //
translated: the giving of texts, the teaching of the scriptures according to the texts, and the teaching of the preceptor.

original: zang zing sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The generosity of material things is also threefold:

original: phyi'i zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / nang gi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / nang gi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of external goods, the generosity of internal goods, and the generosity of both external and internal goods.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is also threefold:

original: rkyen gyi sdug bsngal las bskyab pa dang / srog gi bar chad las bskyab pa dang / 'khor @4b ba'i rgyud las bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi sdug bsngal las bskyab pa dang / srog gi bar chad las bskyab pa dang / 'khor @4b ba'i rgyud las bskyab pa'o //
translated: protection from the suffering of conditions, protection from obstacles to life, and protection from the causes of retinue.

original: de la yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Therein, the power of virtue becomes threefold:

original: chos sbyin pas ni 'jig rten las 'das par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos sbyin pas ni 'jig rten las 'das par 'gyur /
translated: By the generosity of Dharma, one becomes supramundane.

original: zang zing sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen po 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen po 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: By the generosity of goods, one obtains great wealth.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshe la bar chad med par 'gyur ro //üîΩtshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshe la bar chad med par 'gyur ro // tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the generosity of fearlessness, one's life becomes free from obstacles.üîΩThe three types of morality are as follows:

original: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The morality of turning away from non-virtue is also threefold:

original: lus mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / ngag mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / yid mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: lus mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / ngag mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / yid mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
translated: turning away from evil bodily actions, turning away from evil speech, and turning away from evil mental actions.

original: dge ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The morality of engaging in virtue is threefold:

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su rton par 'jug pa dang / bsod nams la yid rton par 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su rton par 'jug pa dang / bsod nams la yid rton par 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'jug pa'o //
translated: engaging in the practice of taking refuge in the Three Jewels, engaging in the practice of accumulating merit, and engaging in the practice of realizing the ultimate realm.

original: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of living beings is threefold:

original: yongs su ma smin pa smin par bya ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dgrol ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las bzla ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa smin par bya ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dgrol ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las bzla ba'o //
translated: ripening those who are not yet ripe, liberating those who are not yet liberated, and bringing final nirvana to those who have not yet attained it.

original: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: In this context, there are three kinds of spiritual power:

original: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: By the morality of turning away from evil, one is reborn in the higher realms.

original: dge ba la 'dzud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba la 'dzud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: By the morality of engaging in virtue, one perfects the requisites for enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the morality of engaging in the aims of sentient beings, one accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three kinds of patience areüîΩthe patience of not retaliating, the patience of accepting suffering, and the patience of ascertaining the Dharma.

original: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The patience of not retaliating is threefold:

original: gshe yang phyir mi gshe par bya ba dang / brdeg kyang phyir mi brdeg par bya ba dang / smad kyang phyir mi smad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gshe yang phyir mi gshe par bya ba dang / brdeg kyang phyir mi brdeg par bya ba dang / smad kyang phyir mi smad par bya ba'o //
translated: one does not retaliate in return for abuse, one does not retaliate in return for beating, and one does not retaliate in return for threats.

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The patience of accepting suffering is threefold:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can thams cad kyi don bya bas mi skyo ba'i bzod pa dang / spyod lam dam pa la log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis spa mi bkong ba'i bzod pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa zhi zhing spong bar bzod pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can thams cad kyi don bya bas mi skyo ba'i bzod pa dang / spyod lam dam pa la log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis spa mi bkong ba'i bzod pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa zhi zhing spong bar bzod pa'o //
translated: the patience of not being discouraged by the necessity of working for the sake of all sentient beings in the future; the patience of not being intimidated by the suffering of the wrong practice of the holy life; and the patience of enduring the passions such as desire.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The patience of ascertaining the Dharma is threefold:

original: stong pas mi skrag pa dang / mtha' gnyis la mi chags pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa la brtan par bzod pa'o //üîΩde la yang yon tan @5a * //
analyzed: stong pas mi skrag pa dang / mtha' gnyis la mi chags pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa la brtan par bzod pa'o // de la yang yon tan @5a * //
translated: He is not frightened by emptiness, he is not attached to the two extremes, and he is patient in enduring hardships.

original: gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: And in this regard, there are three kinds of power of virtue:

original: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: By the patience of not retaliating against those who harm him, he obtains an excellent retinue.

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pas ni ma rabs kyi sems spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pas ni ma rabs kyi sems spong bar 'gyur /
translated: By the patience of not being upset by suffering, he abandons the attitude of a low person.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the patience of being certain about the Dharma, he generates undefiled wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three kinds of effort are:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The armor-effort is also threefold:

original: byams pa chen po'i go bgo ba dang / snying rje chen po'i mthu brtan pa dang / brtson 'grus chen po'i mthu brtan pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i go bgo ba dang / snying rje chen po'i mthu brtan pa dang / brtson 'grus chen po'i mthu brtan pa'o //
translated: the donning of the armor of great love, the firming up of the resolve of great compassion, and the firming up of the resolve of great effort.

original: dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The effort of application to virtue is also threefold:

original: dad pa chen pos don la rton pa dang / spyod pa chen pos dge ba la 'jug pa dang / bsngo ba chen pos sems can la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa chen pos don la rton pa dang / spyod pa chen pos dge ba la 'jug pa dang / bsngo ba chen pos sems can la khyab pa'o //
translated: The great faith is the reliance on the meaning. The great morality is the engagement in virtue. The great dedication is the pervasion of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The effort applied to the benefit of sentient beings is also threefold.

original: snyoms pa dang tshul khrims la khyad par med par brtson pa dang / bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i thabs kyis chos kyi don la 'jog par brtson pa dang / gnyen po mi 'gong ba'i shes rab kyis thabs su brtson pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms pa dang tshul khrims la khyad par med par brtson pa dang / bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i thabs kyis chos kyi don la 'jog par brtson pa dang / gnyen po mi 'gong ba'i shes rab kyis thabs su brtson pa'o //
translated: The effort applied to the equality of mind is the effort to be impartial toward sentient beings. The effort applied to morality is the effort to be impartial toward the moral and immoral. The effort applied to the Dharma is the effort to establish sentient beings in the meaning of the Dharma by means of the four social practices. The effort applied to the benefit of sentient beings is the effort to establish sentient beings in the meaning of the Dharma by means of the four social practices. The effort applied to the benefit of sentient beings is the effort to establish sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the power of the virtues becomes threefold.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis ni bdud bzhi thul bar 'gyur //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis ni bdud bzhi thul bar 'gyur //
translated: By means of the armor-effort, one conquers the four demons.

original: dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: By means of the effort applied to virtue, one perfects the ten stages.

original: sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni 'dren pa chen po'i thabs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni 'dren pa chen po'i thabs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the effort applied to the benefit of sentient beings, one becomes endowed with the means of the great guide.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The concentration of the three kinds of happiness is threefold.

original: rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩsems chos la mi rtog pa dang / chos sems la mi rtog pa dang / btang snyoms kyi sems gnyi gar mi rtog pa'o //üîΩyon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩsku'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dang / stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste / sems chos la mi rtog pa dang / chos sems la mi rtog pa dang / btang snyoms kyi sems gnyi gar mi rtog pa'o // yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste / sku'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dang / stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the three kinds of happiness is threefold: the concentration of the happiness of dwelling in peace, which is the antidote to the passions and suffering; the concentration of the happiness of dwelling in the nondiscursive, which is the antidote to the passions; and the concentration of the happiness of dwelling in the nondiscursive, which is the antidote to suffering.üîΩThe concentration of the accomplishment of good qualities is threefold: the concentration of the accomplishment of the good qualities of the body, the concentration of the accomplishment of the good qualities of intuition, and the concentration of the accomplishment of the good qualities of the powers, etc.üîΩThe concentration of the accomplishment of the aims of beings is threefold: the concentration of the aim of the conversion of beings, the concentration of the aim of the development of beings, and the concentration of the aim of the liberation of beings.

original: sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩbsngo ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang // khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi 'gyur ba'i @5b ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩbsngo ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang // khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi 'gyur ba'i @5b ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of the aim of the conversion of beings is threefold: the concentration of the aim of the conversion of beings by the body, the concentration of the aim of the conversion of beings by intuition, and the concentration of the aim of the conversion of beings by the teaching.üîΩThe concentration of the aim of the development of beings is threefold: the concentration of the aim of the development of beings by the teaching, the concentration of the aim of the development of beings by the demonstration of psychic power, and the concentration of the aim of the development of beings by the demonstration of the process of liberation.üîΩThe concentration of the aim of the liberation of beings is threefold: the concentration of the aim of the liberation of beings by the teaching, the concentration of the aim of the liberation of beings by the demonstration of psychic power, and the concentration of the aim of the liberation of beings by the demonstration of the process of liberation.

original: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang yon tan gyi mthu rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the power of the virtues becomes threefold:

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i sems kyis sbyin par byed pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed pa dang / mdza' bshes rnams la btang snyoms kyi sems kyis sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i sems kyis sbyin par byed pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed pa dang / mdza' bshes rnams la btang snyoms kyi sems kyis sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: They give with a mind of compassion to those who are suffering. They give with a mind of joy to those who have good qualities. They give with a mind of equanimity to their friends.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
translated: Ten kinds of pure speech are mentioned in the noble S≈´tra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head:

original: sbyin pa'i snga rol nyid kyis sbyin no zhes skabs 'byed pa dang / 'ongs pa na tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / khro gnyer med cing bzhin gyi mdog gsal la 'dzum pa sngar gtong zhing tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis gtam 'dre bar byed phebs par smra bar byed kun dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i snga rol nyid kyis sbyin no zhes skabs 'byed pa dang / 'ongs pa na tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / khro gnyer med cing bzhin gyi mdog gsal la 'dzum pa sngar gtong zhing tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis gtam 'dre bar byed phebs par smra bar byed kun dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: They make a place for the petitioner by saying, I will give before you ask. When the petitioner comes, they say, Come here, you are most welcome. They greet the petitioner with a smile and a clear countenance, free of frowns. They speak pleasantly and in a friendly manner. They are polite, speak cordially, and delight the petitioner.

original: slong mo pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su sbyin par bya ba'i zhes sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pos kun dga' bar byed pa dang / nga ni khyod la sbyin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig kun rjod par byed pa dang / da ni dus byed pa na khro bas kun nas @7b bslang ba'i tshig rtsub mo rjod par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: slong mo pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su sbyin par bya ba'i zhes sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pos kun dga' bar byed pa dang / nga ni khyod la sbyin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig kun rjod par byed pa dang / da ni dus byed pa na khro bas kun nas @7b bslang ba'i tshig rtsub mo rjod par mi byed pa dang /
translated: They delight the petitioner with the gift itself, saying, ‚ÄúHere, take this.‚Äù They use the words ‚ÄúI will give to you.‚Äù They do not speak harsh words motivated by anger when the time comes to give.

original: slong mo pa la mngon sum dang lkog nas mi smod mi sgrogs pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos mi bdog na yang legs par shad kyis sbyangs te gtong bar byed pa dang / slong mo pa la mngon sum du smon par mi byed khyad du gsod par mi byed pa snying bar mi byed co 'dri bar mi byed pa dang /

translated: They do not criticize or proclaim the faults of beggars, either in their presence or behind their backs. Even if they do not have any objects to give, they give well-spoken advice. They do not wish for beggars, despise them, feel indifferent to them, or make fun of them.

original: sma dbab pa nye bar sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sma dbab pa nye bar sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: They do not humiliate them.

original: shes pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
analyzed: shes pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
translated: There are ten kinds of pure knowledge:

original: sbyin pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / slong mo pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / slong mo pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: pure knowledge in regard to giving, pure knowledge in regard to beggars, pure knowledge in regard to the objects to be given, pure knowledge in regard to the application of giving,

original: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: the pure knowledge that is based on bringing sentient beings to full maturity through generosity, the pure knowledge that is based on skill in means, the pure knowledge that is based on the drawbacks of sense objects,

original: dri ma bsal ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su bzung ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyogs drug gi dgab pa nyid la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'o ;
analyzed: dri ma bsal ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su bzung ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyogs drug gi dgab pa nyid la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'o ;
translated: the pure knowledge that is based on removing stains, the pure knowledge that is based on avoiding negative associates and keeping the company of spiritual teachers, and the pure knowledge that is based on the six outer coverings.

original: / dri ma rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
analyzed: / dri ma rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni /
translated: The ten kinds of purity with regard to stains are as follows.

original: le lo'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / chags pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / zhe sdang gi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / ti mug gi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: le lo'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / chags pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / zhe sdang gi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / ti mug gi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give gifts free of the stain of laziness, free of the stain of attachment, free of the stain of anger, free of the stain of ignorance,üîΩfree of the stain of obstruction, free of the stain of unsuitability, free of the stain of incompleteness, free of the stain of impurity,

original: gags kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / mi rigs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / ma rdzogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gags kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / mi rigs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / ma rdzogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / thabs ma yin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / thabs ma yin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: They give gifts free of the stain of faulty wisdom and they give gifts free of the stain of improper means.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun la 'di lta ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni byang @8a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun la 'di lta ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni byang @8a * //
translated: Next, there are seven kinds of purity of morality:

original: chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs morality is called ‚Äúall-inclusive‚Äù because it includes all the bases of training that are included in the bodhisattva‚Äôs vow.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of gathering virtuous factors, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang bya ba gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang bya ba gsum ste /

analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sems gnas par byed la /

analyzed: dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed /

analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed do //

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad 'di lta ste /

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir sems gnas pa dang / lus dang sems dub pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de tsam du zad de /üîΩtshul khrims kyang de dag tu zad la /

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon yang de dag tu zad de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon yang de dag tu zad de /
translated: The benefits of morality are also included in these three.

original: dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' byang chub chen po 'dod pa thams cad kyang 'di la bslabs shing bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas na tshul khrims thams cad ces kyang bya /

analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad ces kyang bya ste /

analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yin no //

original: ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa ste gsum gang zhe na /
translated: There are three causes of skill in rising from downfalls:üîΩgenerating the five regrets,üîΩthe five-branched heedfulness, and

analyzed: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba'o //

analyzed: de la 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa gang zhe na /

original: ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na /
analyzed: ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na /
translated: When any kind of downfall has occurred,

original: bdag nyid la gzhi des tshul khrims dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhan dang lha dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / ston pa tshangs par mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang /

translated: One generates regret thinking, I am reproached by my own mind because of that basis and because of my morality. One generates regret thinking, I am reproached by others and by the gods. One generates regret thinking, I am reproached by the teacher, by the wise, and by my fellow brahmacƒÅrins.

original: phyogs dang phyogs @8b mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi bsngags pa'i grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / bdag lus zhig nas ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar gyur na me rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs @8b mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi bsngags pa'i grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / bdag lus zhig nas ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar gyur na me rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: One generates regret thinking, The praise, fame, renown, and acclaim of the wicked will increase in all directions. One generates regret thinking, It is not right that I should be reborn in the miserable states, the evil destinies, after the destruction of my body.

original: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa gang zhe na /

translated: They are heedfulness in relation to the past, which means to act in accordance with the Dharma with regard to any downfalls that have occurred in the past; heedfulness in relation to the future, which means to act in accordance with the Dharma with regard to any downfalls that may occur in the future;

translated: It is the removal of remorse by thinking: ‚ÄúI have abandoned ignorance, carelessness, the multitude of defilements and disrespect, and I have acquired knowledge, carefulness, the multitude of good qualities and respect.‚Äù

original: bar byed pa dang / yang ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bsam pa thag pa nas sems skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du so sor bshags zin to snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang /

translated: One dispels regret by thinking, I have confessed in the presence of learned companions in the celibate life.üîΩ One dispels regret by thinking, Whatever I have done that is virtuous and good, such as going forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, not violating the trainings, and being without regret, is virtuous and good for me.üîΩ One dispels regret by thinking, Whatever I have done that is not virtuous and good, such as violating the trainings, is not virtuous and good for me.üîΩ One dispels regret by thinking, Whatever I have done that is not virtuous and good, such as violating the trainings, is not virtuous and good for me.

analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: ‚Äú One who is energetic‚Äù is one who has natural effort because of being generated by the power of a previous cause.

translated: ‚Äú One who is enthusiastic‚Äù is one who has the effort of application because of being applied to the virtuous group after careful consideration.

analyzed: brtul ba brtan pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs shing gzhan du sgyur @10a * //
translated: Steadfastness in one's practice means that one is not perturbed by any of the harms of suffering and one does not turn away from them.üîΩ

original: du med pa'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: du med pa'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Steadfastness in practice is the indefatigable effort, because it is not disturbed by any harm from suffering and it cannot be turned back.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag pas dag pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag pas dag pa ste /
translated: Effort in virtuous practices is the pure effort, because of pure application.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi la sbyor ba'i thabs sam rgyu 'am mtshan mar gyur pa mi lcogs pa med pa ni mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi la sbyor ba'i thabs sam rgyu 'am mtshan mar gyur pa mi lcogs pa med pa ni mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The sign is the means, cause, or mark for the preparatory stage of the actual basis of the first meditative concentration.

original: de legs par rtogs pa la brten nas dngos gzhi'i thabs rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de legs par rtogs pa la brten nas dngos gzhi'i thabs rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: The meditative concentration of bodhisattvas is based on the thorough understanding of that sign, and it is the pure means for the actual basis. It is the concentration that is the purity of serenity, insight, and equanimity.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi thob pas ngag pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi thob pas ngag pa ste /
translated: The meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas is the complete meditative concentration, because it is the completion of the attainment of the actual basis.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi thob pa na rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs te gnas pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi thob pa na rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs te gnas pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: Abiding in these is called the complete meditative stabilization.

original: de la brten nas dngos gzhi thob pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas dngos gzhi thob pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: On the basis of that, the bodhisattvas practice meditative stabilization that is completely pure, completely pure in terms of the attainment of the actual basis, completely pure in terms of calm abiding and insight and completely pure in terms of equanimity.

original: gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The practice of meditative stabilization that is a combination of both is as follows.

original: dngos gzhi la khyad par gong ma rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la khyad par gong ma rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is completely pure in terms of the higher special qualities of the actual basis.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs gnyi ga thob pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs gnyi ga thob pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the point at which one attains both the actual basis of the first meditative concentration and the access to the second meditative concentration,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi dngos gzhi dang / srid pa'i rtse mo de nyer bsdogs gnyi ga thob pa'i bar gyi dngos gzhi gcig dang / gnyis thob ste /üîΩrtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs te gnas pas na snang ba yang yang dag par shes la /
