translated: The actual basis of the sphere of nothing whatsoever and the summit of existence are the two actual bases obtained by one who has obtained both access concentrations.

original: gzugs rnams kyang mthong ba ni gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang mthong ba ni gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The concentration of neither ideation nor non-ideation is called the concentration of both parts because it is the concentration in which one accomplishes and abides in a concentration that is without ideation and without investigation, and one correctly knows and sees light.

original: de la brten nas dbang gi thabs rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //üîΩshugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba dang dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas dbang gi thabs rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //üîΩshugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba dang dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the concentration of serenity, insight, and equanimity that is purified on the basis of that concentration by means of the pure method of power.üîΩThe concentration of the pratyekabuddhas is the concentration that arises by the power of the cause, and it is called the concentration of the natural result.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi nyer bsngogs dang / dngos gzhi thams @10b cad thob pa na snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba la btsal mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'grub pa ni shugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi nyer bsngogs dang / dngos gzhi thams @10b cad thob pa na snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba la btsal mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'grub pa ni shugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: When one has attained all the access concentrations and actual bases down to the peak of existence, one enters meditative attainment, abides and arises effortlessly and naturally. This is called the concentration of natural expression.

original: de la brten nas gnas pa la dbang pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //üîΩmi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la brten nas gnas pa la dbang pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o // mi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the basis of that, bodhisattvas practice concentration with the completely pure meditative absorption of sustained calm, profound insight and equanimity, for they have mastery in abiding.

original: bsam gtan bzlog nas yang snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzlog nas yang snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The concentration of nonabiding is the concentration that is completely pure, since, having turned away from the concentrations, one has mastery in entering meditative attainment.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad thob pa na de dag la ro myong ba med cing lugs dang lugs ma yin pa dang / thod rgal dang / yan lag bsdu ba dang / dmigs pa bsdu pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad thob pa na de dag la ro myong ba med cing lugs dang lugs ma yin pa dang / thod rgal dang / yan lag bsdu ba dang / dmigs pa bsdu pa dang /
translated: When they have attained all the concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, they have attained the power of the faculties that are not relishing, not relishing, and not relishing those, and that are the forward order, the reverse order, skipping over, combining the branches, combining the objects,üîΩcombining the branches and objects, and combining the objects and branches.

original: yan lag zung du bya ba dang / dmigs pa zung du bya ba dang / yan lag dang dmigs pa zung du bya ba'i dbang po thob pa ni mi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag zung du bya ba dang / dmigs pa zung du bya ba dang / yan lag dang dmigs pa zung du bya ba'i dbang po thob pa ni mi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the concentration that does not rest.

original: de la brten nas mngon par shes pa sgrub pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas mngon par shes pa sgrub pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: In dependence on that, by the purity of the power of accomplishment of the superknowledges, the bodhisattvas practice concentration that is the complete purity of serenity, insight, and equanimity.

original: shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The concentration that is practiced in a well-refined concentration is called the concentration of the bodhisattvas.

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul ba la dbang rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul ba la dbang rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: And it is pure by means of the pure mastery of the superknowledges and magical powers.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thams cad thob pa na mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thams cad thob pa na mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: When one has attained all those meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative absorptions, and attainments, one has attained mastery of the superknowledges and the knowledge of the doors of liberation, the knowledge of the analytical insights,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa dbang thob pa ni shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa dbang thob pa ni shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: the knowledge of the absence of afflictions, the knowledge of aspiration, and so forth. This is called the meditative absorption of thorough refinement.

original: de la brten nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la dbang ba rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la dbang ba rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: On the basis of that, the bodhisattvas practice meditative concentration with the complete purity of serenity, insight, and equanimity, which is the purity of the mastery of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par dag pa dang / nyon @11a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni / lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par dag pa dang / nyon @11a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas' concentration is called the meditation on the infinite samadhis that are the immeasurable cultivation of the focus of the Bodhisattva Canon.

original: mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure in being free from all views and pure in eliminating the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thob pa na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thob pa na /
translated: When they attain those concentrations, liberations, samadhis, and absorptions,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa dang / bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dmigs pa la brten te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thob pa dang / bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dmigs pa la brten te /
translated: they attain the Bodhisattva Canon and, based on the focus that is preceded by the intention,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
translated: they accomplish the qualities of the bodhisattvas' samadhi. The concentrations included in the ten powers' types are various and inconceivable.

original: tshad med pa sgrub par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ming yang mi shes na /üîΩsnyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / rnam par thar ba dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa sgrub par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ming yang mi shes na / snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / rnam par thar ba dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang /
translated: It is the attainment of limitless concentrations, such as the four boundless attitudes, the four formless states and the eight deliverances, which even the listeners and solitary realizers do not know the names of, let alone enter into meditative equipoise on them.üîΩIt is the attainment of limitless concentrations that accomplish the qualities that are not held in common with the listeners and solitary realizers, such as the four kinds of correct understanding, the four aspects of correct knowledge, the four analytical knowledges, the six kinds of preternatural knowledge, the ten masteries, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four things that need not be guarded against, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, great compassion, the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the ten powers, the four kinds of perfect knowledge, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the six kinds of preternatural knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, great compassion, the knowledge of all aspects and so forth.

original: thun mong ba rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la dbang thob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong ba rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la dbang thob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of mastery in limitless concentrations is called the bodhisattvas' concentration of the limitless cultivation of the focus of the scriptural collection.

original: de la brten nas mu stegs can tshar gcad pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'brel pa bla na med pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas mu stegs can tshar gcad pa la dbang ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'brel pa bla na med pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
translated: On the basis of that, they practice concentration with the completely pure serenity, insight and equanimity of bodhisattvas, which is the completely pure mastery in the destruction of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de dag ni rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan sngar bstan pa dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan sngar bstan pa dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: These should be applied as appropriate to the previously explained pure meditative concentration.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun la 'di lta ste /
translated: After that, there are seven kinds of pure wisdom:üîΩThe wisdom that is the means of attaining one's own goal, the wisdom that is the means of attaining others' goals, the wisdom that is the means of attaining both one's own and others' goals, the wisdom that is the means of attaining the goal of liberation, the wisdom that is the means of attaining the goal of omniscience, the wisdom that is the means of attaining the goal of the great enlightenment and the wisdom that is the means of attaining the goal of the welfare of others.

original: de'i shes rab de sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs te dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi don thob par bya ba'i thabs kyis lam yang dag par ston pa'i shes rab ste /

analyzed: rnam @11b par grol bas rnam par dag pa yin no //

analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi tshig gi don ni sngar gleng gzhi'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi don yang dag par ston pa'i shes rab ste /

analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
