original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa lnga po de dag gis so so'i las gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa lnga po de dag gis so so'i las gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the Bhagavan was asked, What is the individual function of these five aspects?

original: de dag gi las kyang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi las kyang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be understood that their functions are also fivefold, means

original: lnga po re re'i las kyang re rer bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lnga po re re'i las kyang re rer bsdu ba'o //
translated: that the function of each of the five is included in each.

original: chags pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa nyid kyis tshe 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa la bag yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa nyid kyis tshe 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa la bag yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: By non-attachment, etc., it is taught that in this life, one is heedful in the perfections by means of non-attachment to all aspects of phenomena that obstruct the perfections.

original: mi lta ba nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bu dang zang zing la sems 'brel pa med pa nyid kyis phyi ma la pha rol tu phyin pa la bag yod pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bstan to //üîΩkha na ma tho ba med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa phun sum tshogs pa sgom par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi lta ba nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bu dang zang zing la sems 'brel pa med pa nyid kyis phyi ma la pha rol tu phyin pa la bag yod pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bstan to // kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa phun sum tshogs pa sgom par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: By not seeing a sentient being, etc. shows that by not being attached to the result and to material things, one takes up the cause of heedfulness in the transcendences in the future.üîΩBy being irreproachable, etc. shows that by completely avoiding the secondary mental addictions, one cultivates the perfection of the transcendences.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi lta ba nyid kyis myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi lta ba nyid kyis myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: By being nonconceptual, etc. shows that by not seeing the imagined reality, one quickly perfects the transcendences.

original: yongs su bsngo ba @12b nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par smon lam 'debs pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang zhar la 'grub la pha rol tu phyin pa mi
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba @12b nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par smon lam 'debs pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang zhar la 'grub la pha rol tu phyin pa mi
translated: By the dedication itself, the fruitional effect is also accomplished as a byproduct, by the very fact of praying to attain the full enlightenment of buddhahood.üîΩ

original: zad pa nyid kyang thob par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zad pa nyid kyang thob par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: By the dedication itself, one prays for the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. By that very fact, the evolutionary result is also accomplished as a by-product, and one obtains the inexhaustible perfections.

original: gdags pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gdags pa bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the summary of the designations has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the summary of the distinctions of virtues should be explained.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The distinctions of virtues are the two kinds of virtues of the perfections:

original: phul du byung ba dang / rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba dang / rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: excellence and purity.

original: de la phul du byung ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: de la phul du byung ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: Excellence is due to two causes:

original: rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas so //
translated: magnificence and non-addictedness.

original: rnam par dag pa ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
translated: Purity is due to three causes:

original: sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis te /
translated: purity of purification, purity of non-perturbation, and purity of extreme purification.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught here in order to demonstrate expertise in those.

original: de la rgya che bas phul du byung ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la rgya che bas phul du byung ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, the superiority of the universal vehicle is taught in terms of the supremacy of its magnanimity.üîΩThe question, Bhagavan, what is the magnanimity of these perfections?

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rgya che ba nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rgya che ba nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: is asked in order to demonstrate the supremacy of magnanimity.

original: de la rgya che ba ni sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgya che ba ni sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pa ste /
translated: In this regard, magnanimity is due to the absence of differentiation with regard to sentient beings, the absence of differentiation with regard to entities, and the absence of differentiation with regard to time.

original: sems can la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten cing brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed kyi bdag 'ba' zhig kho na'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten cing brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed kyi bdag 'ba' zhig kho na'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The absence of differentiation with regard to sentient beings is the bodhisattva's practice of those roots of virtue such as generosity, etc. in dependence upon and in relation to all sentient beings, and not just for the sake of himself alone.

original: dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang ; rnam pa thams cad yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang ; rnam pa thams cad yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Non-differentiation in regard to things is the undertaking and practice of all those wholesome roots, such as generosity, in all their aspects.

original: dus la dbye ba med pa ni tshe 'di la mtshan mo dang nyin mo rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus la dbye ba med pa ni tshe 'di la mtshan mo dang nyin mo rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Non-differentiation in regard to time is the uninterrupted application in this life, day and night, without abandoning effort and without forsaking striving, and by that very cause, the practice of those wholesome roots in all lives.

original: de'i phyir chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äúthat which is non-attachment, non-viewing and dedication.‚Äù

original: chags pa med pa la sogs pa gsum po re re yang sems can la dbye ba med pa la sogs pa gsum gsum gyis rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med pa la sogs pa gsum po re re yang sems can la dbye ba med pa la sogs pa gsum gsum gyis rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Each of the three, non-attachment and so on, is extensive because of the three, non-differentiation in regard to sentient beings and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin @13a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin @13a * //
translated: It is not defiled

original: pas phul du byung ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: pas phul du byung ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, in terms of the teaching of the highest,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the absence of defilement?‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mchog tu dga' ba dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang / mi brten pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mchog tu dga' ba dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang / mi brten pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The absence of defilement is the highest joy, the absence of opposition, respect, non-dependence, and the highest joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rten par byed cing gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rten par byed cing gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, with a joyful mind, without suffering, without mental dissatisfaction, relies on those wholesome roots, and on that basis does not regret it.

original: mi mthun pa med pa ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur ba rnams la mngon par zhen pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur ba rnams la mngon par zhen pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The absence of opposition is the practice of those wholesome roots without harming others and without attachment to views.

original: gus pa ni gus pa dang snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan dang snying por lta ba shin tu nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyi sa mi bkri bar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o ;üîΩ/ mi brten pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam /
analyzed: gus pa ni gus pa dang snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan dang snying por lta ba shin tu nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyi sa mi bkri bar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o ; / mi brten pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam /
translated: Not relying on others means that one does not follow others, but rather takes up and practices those roots of virtue oneself.

original: brgya byin nyid dam /
analyzed: brgya byin nyid dam /
translated: Not being dependent means not hoping for the evolutionary development of those roots of virtue to be a universal monarch,üîΩ≈öakra,

original: bdud nyid dam /
analyzed: bdud nyid dam /
translated: a demon,

original: tshangs pa nyid du re ba med pa dang / gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la brten pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid du re ba med pa dang / gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la brten pa med pa'o //
translated: or BrahmƒÅ, and not being dependent on others for a reward, or on gain, honor, or fame.

original: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be irreproachable and nonconceptual.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid la sogs pa gnyis po re re yang mchog tu dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi bzhis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid la sogs pa gnyis po re re yang mchog tu dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi bzhis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two, being without reproach, etc., are each of four kinds, supreme joy, etc., because they are not defiled.

original: de ltar rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba dang / bla na med pa dang / thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba dang / bla na med pa dang / thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfections are to be known as preeminent, unsurpassed, and exclusive because of their greatness and because they are not defiled.

original: sbyangs pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sbyangs pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purification by means of purification,

original: sbyangs pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: sbyangs pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is purification?‚Äù

original: sbyangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba so sor brtag cing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling pa dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba ste /
analyzed: sbyangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba so sor brtag cing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling pa dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba ste /
translated: Purification is the roots of virtue of one who has entered the stage of pure thought, which are examined and cultivated, and which are naturally firm, clear, fruitful, and beneficial.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtag cing bya ba nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtag cing bya ba nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is just the investigation and performance of those.

original: mi g-yo ba nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: ‚Äù With the aim of teaching the purity of stability,

original: mi g-yo @13b ba nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: mi g-yo @13b ba nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is stability?‚Äù

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Stability means that the roots of virtue of one who has entered the stage of certainty do not turn back from the way they were obtained and the way they were accumulated, and they do not deteriorate and they progress.

original: de'i phyir sar chud pa rnams kyi yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sar chud pa rnams kyi yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is the nature of those who have entered the stages not to deteriorate.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: ‚Äù With the aim of teaching the purity of complete purity,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is complete purity?‚Äù

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gang na med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gang na med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Very pure means that the roots of virtue belonging to the tenth stage and those belonging to the stage of the Buddha are not surpassed by any other roots of virtue, which are certain and final, on the bodhisattva stages.

original: de'i phyir sa bcu par gtogs pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bcu par gtogs pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, those belonging to the tenth stage and those belonging to the stage of the Buddha.

original: de ltar sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfections should be understood as purified because of their very purity, their immobility, and their extreme purity.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the skill in the distinctions of virtues, etc., has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the skill in uninterruptedness, etc., should be explained.

original: rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa zad mi shes pa yang rtag tu ldan la pha rol tu phyin pa zad mi shes pa dang yang rtag tu ldan te /
analyzed: rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa zad mi shes pa yang rtag tu ldan la pha rol tu phyin pa zad mi shes pa dang yang rtag tu ldan te /
translated: Skill in the uninterrupted continuity of the result of evolutionary progress refers to the fact that the bodhisattva is always endowed with the inexhaustible results of evolutionary progress of the transcendences, and is also always endowed with the inexhaustible transcendences themselves.

original: rnam par smin pa dang sbyor ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang sbyor ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the skill in the uninterrupted continuity of the result of evolutionary progress and of practice.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas ma 'tshal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pas ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa lags zhes zhus pas so ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas ma 'tshal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pas ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa lags zhes zhus pas so ;
translated: Blessed One, why is it that the bodhisattva is always endowed with the inexhaustible results of evolutionary progress of the transcendences, and with the inexhaustible transcendences themselves?

original: / gcig la gcig brten nas 'grub pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / gcig la gcig brten nas 'grub pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are accomplished in mutual dependence.

original: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pa la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the practice of the transcendences in the past,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zad mi shes pa dang ldan pas de la brten nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod pas de lta bu'i brgyud pa'i tshul gyis @14a * //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zad mi shes pa dang ldan pas de la brten nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod pas de lta bu'i brgyud pa'i tshul gyis @14a * //
translated: And because it possesses inexhaustible fruitions, one relies on it and so never stops applying the transcendent perfections.üîΩ

original: rnam par smin pa dang / sbyor ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / sbyor ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since it possesses inexhaustible fruitions, one relies on it and does not interrupt the practice of the transcendent perfections. In this way, the fruitions and the practice of the transcendent perfections continue uninterrupted.

original: rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the skill in continuity and so on have already been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu rgyu nyid la mkhas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu rgyu nyid la mkhas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the skill in means in the knowledge of the cause and so on should be explained.

original: rgyu nyid la gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dad pas gnas par bya ba ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod
analyzed: rgyu nyid la gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dad pas gnas par bya ba ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod
translated: Skill in means in abiding in the cause refers to the transcendent perfections that are the cause of the fruitional effect of the transcendent perfections. One should abide in them with faith, since one desires the fruitional effect of the transcendent perfections.

original: pa la dad pas gnas par bya ba ma yin pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa la dad pas gnas par bya ba ma yin pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the skill in the faith that is to be practiced and the faith that is not to be practiced.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas pa ma lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas pa ma lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the Lord was asked, ‚ÄúWhy, O Lord, do the bodhisattvas not have faith in the desire for the ripened effect of the perfections as they do in the perfections themselves?‚Äù

original: rgyu lnga'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu lnga'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor five reasons‚Äù is the cause.

original: gnas 'byung ba lnga'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dad pas gnas pa ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas 'byung ba lnga'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dad pas gnas pa ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Because of the five reasons, the desire for the ripened effect of the perfections is not to be practiced with faith as the perfections are to be practiced with faith.

original: de nyid rgyu nyid la gnas par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu nyid la gnas par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: This itself is the skill in the means of abiding in the cause.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni ches lhag par bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni ches lhag par bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfections are the cause of the highest happiness and mental joy.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni /
translated: The one who is established in the result of evolutionary development

original: gal te na skyo ba dang yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te na skyo ba dang yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin gyi /
translated: is sometimes the cause of weariness and disgust.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the one who is established in faith in the perfections is not like that.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfections are the cause of benefit to self and other.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni bdag la phan pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni bdag la phan pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The one who is established in the result of evolutionary development benefits only himself.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the one who is established in faith in the perfections is the cause of the evolutionary development of the qualities of a Buddha in himself and the evolutionary development of sentient beings.

original: phyi ma la de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi ma la de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfections are the cause of the desire for the result of evolutionary development in the future.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gzhan la phan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gzhan la phan pa yang ma yin /
translated: One who abides in the result of evolutionary development is not a cause of benefit to others,

original: tshe phyi ma la phan pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la phan pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor of benefit in future lives.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang / tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang / tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one who abides in faith in the transcendences is a cause of benefit to others and of benefit in future lives.

original: kun @14b nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gal te kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhir yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun @14b nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gal te kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhir yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is the basis of the absence of addictions. One who abides in the result of evolutionary development is a basis of the addictions, because of the possibility of the addictions in the presence of addictions.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one who abides in faith in the transcendences is not like that.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zad pa'i chos can gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin pas zad miüîΩshes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zad pa'i chos can gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas gnas pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin pas zad mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment, because it is inexhaustible.

original: rgyu nyid la gnas pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyu nyid la gnas pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words skill in cause and so on have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu bya ba sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu bya ba sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words skill in accomplishing activity and so on should be explained.

original: bya ba sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in accomplishing activity is

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po so so'i chos kyi mthu la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po so so'i chos kyi mthu la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: the skill in the power of the individual dharmas of the six perfections. This is what is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi so so'i mthu gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi so so'i mthu gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the Bhagavan, what is the individual power of those perfections?

original: de dag gi so so'i mthu ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi so so'i mthu ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: The power of each of these should be known to be of four kinds. The four kinds of power are: the elimination of counteragents, the bringing about of the full maturation of the stores, the benefitting of self and other, and the production of results in the future.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa rab tu spong ba zhes bya ba bstan to //üîΩtshogs yongs su smin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa rab tu spong ba zhes bya ba bstan to // tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa ni /
translated: The elimination of counteragents is shown by the statement: ‚ÄúIn the practice of the perfections, he eliminates the counteragents of stinginess, immorality, malice, laziness, distraction, and false wisdom.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The bringing about of the full maturation of the stores is shown by the statement: ‚ÄúIt becomes the store for the attainment of supreme enlightenment.‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni /
translated: The benefitting of self and other is shown by the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is the cause of the attainment of the two aims.‚Äù

original: tshe 'di la bdag dang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bdag dang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The phrase they will benefit oneself and sentient beings in this life teaches this.

original: phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa ni phyi ma la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa rgya chen po zad mi shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa ni phyi ma la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa rgya chen po zad mi shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The phrase they will yield results in the future teaches that one will obtain the great and inexhaustible results of evolutionary development in future lives.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag so so'i rab tu dbye ba ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'u chos kyi mthu bstan pa'i skabs su rgya cher bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩbya ba sgrub @15a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag so so'i rab tu dbye ba ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'u chos kyi mthu bstan pa'i skabs su rgya cher bstan pa bzhin no // bya ba sgrub @15a * //
translated: The individual classifications of these four kinds of results should be understood as they are explained in detail in the chapter of the noble Maitreya in the Bodhisattva Stages.

original: pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meanings of the terms for the four kinds of results have now been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The next section of the commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization should explain the terms for the benefits of accomplishing the perfections, but it does not do so.

original: yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang dang 'bras bu gang dang don chen po gang gis yongs su bsdus pa'i de'i don yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon te
analyzed: yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang dang 'bras bu gang dang don chen po gang gis yongs su bsdus pa'i de'i don yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon te
translated: Skill in the benefit of perfect accomplishment through their inclusion is the benefit of the perfect accomplishment of the meaning of those transcendences through whatever cause, whatever result, and whatever great import they include.

original: / rgyu de dang 'bras bu de dang don de dag nyid de'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon yin pas de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: / rgyu de dang 'bras bu de dang don de dag nyid de'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon yin pas de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o ;
translated: That cause, that result, and that import are themselves the benefit of their perfect accomplishment.

original: / de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: / de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that meaning, the Lord was asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gang dang ldan pa dang / don gang dang ldan pa lags zhes bya ba zhus so //üîΩsnying rje'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gang dang ldan pa dang / don gang dang ldan pa lags zhes bya ba zhus so // snying rje'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavat, from what cause do those transcendences arise, what result do they have, and what is their great import?‚ÄùüîΩArising from the cause of compassion means

original: snying rje ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that compassion is the root of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase endowed with the result of evolutionary development and the result of benefiting sentient beings indicates that it is endowed with the results of evolutionary development and natural outcome.

original: byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don chen po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don chen po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Endowed with the great purpose of perfecting great enlightenment indicates that it is the basis of the great purpose.

original: yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yongs su bsdus pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i phan yon la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The benefits of the accomplishment of the collections have been explained in the topics of the words and so on.

original: // / de'i 'og tu sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i gegs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i gegs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next are the topics of the words and so on of the skill in the hindrance to benefiting sentient beings.

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in the hindrance to benefiting sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod zad mi shes pa dang ldan pas sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyang bdog la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod zad mi shes pa dang ldan pas sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyang bdog la /
translated: The bodhisattva has the wealth of inexhaustible resources and has the things to give.

original: snying rje can yin pas sems can sdud pa yin yang /
analyzed: snying rje can yin pas sems can sdud pa yin yang /
translated: Although they are compassionate and gather sentient beings,

original: sems can dbul po dag tu snang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs su sems can de dag gi rang gi las kyi nyes pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dbul po dag tu snang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs su sems can de dag gi rang gi las kyi nyes pa yod pa ste /
translated: the appearance of sentient beings as poor is due to the fault of their own karma, which is an obstacle to the bodhisattvas' benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of what is to be understood here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod pas ma 'tshal ba dang @15b ldan pa dang / snying rje can lags na ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod pas ma 'tshal ba dang @15b ldan pa dang / snying rje can lags na ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the question is asked: Blessed One, if bodhisattvas are not lacking in resources, are endowed with compassion, and are compassionate, why are there poor people in the world?

original: de ni sems can rnams kyis rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs ni sems can rang gi las kyi nyes pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams kyis rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs ni sems can rang gi las kyi nyes pa yin par ston to //
translated: It is solely due to the fault of their own karma, the sentient beings' own karma. This shows that the obstacle to the bodhisattvas' benefit of sentient beings is the fault of sentient beings' own karma.

original: de la rtag tu bya ba nyid la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la snying rjes sems can gyi don bya ba nyid la zhugs pa rtag tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag tu bya ba nyid la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la snying rjes sems can gyi don bya ba nyid la zhugs pa rtag tu yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are always engaged in the practice means that these bodhisattvas are always engaged in the practice of benefiting sentient beings out of compassion.

original: 'bras bu med pa gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la longs spyod dang snying rje yod kyang sems can dbul po snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la longs spyod dang snying rje yod kyang sems can dbul po snang ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are not without result means that even though the bodhisattvas have wealth and compassion, they still see poor sentient beings.

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i gegs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the skill in means chapter and so on have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the skill in means chapter and so on should be explained.

original: thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za bar bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase they are skilled in the non-wastage of the engagement in means means that they are skilled in ensuring that the engagement in the means for realizing reality is not wasted.

original: de yang don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos 'dzin pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos 'dzin pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, since all phenomena are ultimately without an essence, there is no apprehension of the essence of a phenomenon that is without an essence.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi sgo nas ma bstan na chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs med pa na ;
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi sgo nas ma bstan na chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs med pa na ;
translated: However, if it is not taught conventionally, there is no means of realizing reality.

original: tha snyad kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to zhes bstan pa ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to zhes bstan pa ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the teaching that the perfection of wisdom apprehends conventionally is called ‚Äúthe non-wastage of the means of engaging in the realization of reality.‚Äù

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of being skilled in that, which is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in the context of teaching that,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis 'dzin pa lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis 'dzin pa lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the Bhagavan was asked, ‚ÄúBhagavan, by what perfection is a bodhisattva to apprehend the non-entityness of phenomena?‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de ni de'i gnas skabs na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid med mod kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de ni de'i gnas skabs na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid med mod kyi /
translated: This is the ultimate realitylessness, and at that time there is no apprehended object and no apprehending subject.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi sgo nas de'i don rtogs par bya ba'i thabs med pas 'dir tha snyad kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi sgo nas de'i don rtogs par bya ba'i thabs med pas 'dir tha snyad kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za
translated: Nevertheless, since there is no means of understanding its meaning except through conventional expressions, here it is said that the perfection of wisdom apprehends it through conventional expressions.

original: ba yin par ston to //
analyzed: ba yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that the method of understanding reality is not wasted.

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @16a * //
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @16a * //
translated: If the perfection of wisdom apprehends realitylessness,

original: pas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin na /
analyzed: pas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin na /
translated: then it has an object.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang ci'i slad du mi 'dzin lags zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba yin pas de
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang ci'i slad du mi 'dzin lags zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba yin pas de
translated: Since the statement ‚Äúall phenomena are essenceless‚Äù is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena, which is the ultimate essencelessness,

original: ni tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ni tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: it is the characteristic of the complete cessation of all conventions.

original: de la ni gang gzung ba dang gang 'dzin pa'i tha snyad med pa yin na /
analyzed: de la ni gang gzung ba dang gang 'dzin pa'i tha snyad med pa yin na /
translated: In that, there is no convention of anything apprehended and anything apprehending.üîΩIf it is apprehended by the perfection of wisdom, then since it would be a permanent existent called an ‚Äúessenceless phenomenon,‚Äù which is a thing to be apprehended,

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su 'dzin na ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba gzung ba'i dngos por rtag tu rung ba cig yod par gyur pas de lta na dngos po med pa'i zla dngos po yod pa cig kyang yod
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su 'dzin na ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba gzung ba'i dngos por rtag tu rung ba cig yod par gyur pas de lta na dngos po med pa'i zla dngos po yod pa cig kyang yod
translated: it would be logical that the existent counterpart of the nonexistent would exist.

original: pa'i rigs pas de yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhes gal gzung ste zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rigs pas de yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhes gal gzung ste zhus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, why do you not apprehend it?

original: da ni ngo bo med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now, it is not said that the perfection of wisdom apprehends the reality of phenomena by way of the realitylessness of the apprehended and apprehender,

original: don dam par na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gnyis med pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin par
analyzed: don dam par na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gnyis med pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin par
translated: because, ultimately, the perfection of wisdom and the realitylessness of phenomena are not dual in the aspect of apprehended and apprehender.

original: ro gcig pas des de 'dzin to zhes mi smra ste /
analyzed: ro gcig pas des de 'dzin to zhes mi smra ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not said that the perfection of wisdom apprehends the realitylessness of phenomena, because they are of one taste.

original: de tsam du gzhag na chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal mod kyi /
analyzed: de tsam du gzhag na chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal mod kyi /
translated: If it were posited in that way, it would not contradict reality, because the nondisturbance of reality would not be disturbed.

original: tha snyad la ma brten par don dam par 'dogs par mi 'gyur bas chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad la ma brten par don dam par 'dogs par mi 'gyur bas chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: However, it is the intention that the method of realizing reality would not be wasted, because the ultimate would not be designated without depending on convention.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i yi ges bstan pa med par don dam pa yi ge med par so sor rig pa de bstan par
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i yi ges bstan pa med par don dam pa yi ge med par so sor rig pa de bstan par
translated: But and so on indicate that the teaching of the ultimate, the individual intuitive knowledge of the perfection of wisdom, which is the realitylessness of all things, is not taught by the words she takes up the perfection of wisdom.

original: nus pas de skad ma bstan na chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud za bar bstan to //
analyzed: nus pas de skad ma bstan na chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud za bar bstan to //
translated: If it were not taught in this way, the engagement in the means of understanding reality would be wasted.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin to zhes de skad brjod do zhes bya bas ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir de skad brjod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin to zhes de skad brjod do zhes bya bas ni chos nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir de skad brjod do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, she is said to take up realitylessness indicates that it is taught in this way in order to prevent the waste of the engagement in the means of understanding reality.

original: thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words skill in the nonwaste of engagement in the means has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu 'grib pa dang 'phel ba'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu 'grib pa dang 'phel ba'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words decrease and increase should be explained.

original: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba la @16b mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba la @16b mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in decrease and increase means

original: 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba gsum smos pa la snga ma snga ma ni chung ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba gsum smos pa la snga ma snga ma ni chung ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya /
translated: Here, the three terms perfection, near perfection, and great perfection are mentioned. The former is called decrease because it is small,

original: phyi ma phyi ma ni che ba'i phyir 'phel ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma ni che ba'i phyir 'phel ba zhes bya ste /
translated: and the latter is called increase because it is great.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: Skill in these is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: the question Bhagavan, why is it called a perfection? and so on is asked.

original: dus dpag tu med pa nas yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dus dpag tu med pa nas yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa ste /
translated: The phrase completely cultivated for immeasurable time refers to those abiding on the level of practice through belief who are abiding in small maturity,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa yin no //
translated: who belong to the first incalculable eon.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is endowed with the virtues of generosity and so on means

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid ma yin pa de gsum las gzhan pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid ma yin pa de gsum las gzhan pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: he is endowed with the virtues of generosity and so on that are not the factors conducive to enlightenment, not the purifications, not the immovabilities, and not the complete purities.üîΩHe is subject to the arising of the afflictions means

original: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni de 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung bas nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa kun tu 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde zil gyis mnan par mi nus kyi des zil gyis non par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dang des te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni de 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung bas nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa kun tu 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o // de zil gyis mnan par mi nus kyi des zil gyis non par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dang des te /
translated: he is subject to the arising of the entanglements of the afflictions due to his weak aspiration and weak application.üîΩHe is unable to overcome them, and is overcome by them means

original: ngan song rnams su yang lan 'ga' 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang lan 'ga' 'gro ba'o //
translated: he is overcome by those afflictions, and is reborn in the lower realms.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ma gtogs pa man chad do //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ma gtogs pa man chad do //
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, the bodhisattva is said to have entered the lesser stage of earnest aspiration, and the middling stage of earnest aspiration, which is below the supreme mundane state.

original: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa yongs su smin pa 'bring la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa yongs su smin pa 'bring la zhugs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, having cultivated for an immeasurable time, he has entered the stage of pure universal responsibility, and has entered the middling stage of maturity.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs pa yin no //
translated: He belongs to the second incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid dang ni ldan la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid dang ni ldan la /
translated: Endowed with those very virtuous qualities means that he is endowed with the virtues of generosity and so on, the factors of enlightenment, purification, and immovability,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: but not with their extreme purity.

original: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun 'byung la zhes bya ba ni de 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa ngan song ma yin pa kun du 'byung ba'o //üîΩde zil @17a * //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun 'byung la zhes bya ba ni de 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa ngan song ma yin pa kun du 'byung ba'o // de zil @17a * //
translated: The afflictions are the origin of suffering for those who possess middling aspiration and middling application.üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThey overpower the afflictions and are not overpowered by them.‚Äù

original: gyis gnon cing de zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang nyon mongs pa de dang des te ngan song rnams su mi 'gro ba'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gyis gnon cing de zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang nyon mongs pa de dang des te ngan song rnams su mi 'gro ba'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not go to the lower realms because they overpower the afflictions and are not overpowered by them.üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúBeginning with the first spiritual level.‚Äù

original: sa dang po nas bzung ba zhes bya ba ni sa dang po yan chad nas sa bdun pa man chad do //
analyzed: sa dang po nas bzung ba zhes bya ba ni sa dang po yan chad nas sa bdun pa man chad do //
translated: The first spiritual level is the one that is attained. The remaining ones are the ones that are possessed.

original: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas chos shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas chos shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúFor an immeasurable length of time, they cultivate the Dharma to a very high degree.‚Äù

original: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur ba'i sa la zhugs pa yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur ba'i sa la zhugs pa yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa ste /
translated: They are those who have entered the stage that is the culmination of the certainty of the stage of a pure superior attitude. They are those who are abiding in the great form of spiritual ripening.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs pa yin no //
translated: They are those who are included among the bodhisattvas of the third incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa nyid mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing those very virtuous qualities means possessing the virtues of generosity and so on, the factors of enlightenment, purification, immovability, and complete purity.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i chos can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i chos can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, having become one who has the quality of never again being subject to affliction in any way whatsoever means

original: de 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che bas nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa kun tu mi 'byung zhing ngan song rnams su mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che bas nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa kun tu mi 'byung zhing ngan song rnams su mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: that, due to great aspiration and great application, the afflictions do not arise and one does not go to the lower realms.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩsa brgyad pa nas bzung ba zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sa brgyad pa nas bzung ba zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa bcu pa man chad do //
analyzed: sa bcu pa man chad do //
translated: Beginning from the eighth stage means from the eighth stage up to the tenth stage.

original: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words skill in decrease and increase and so on has already been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ji skad bstan pa de dag gis rab tu phye ba'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa rab tu dbye
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ji skad bstan pa de dag gis rab tu phye ba'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa rab tu dbye
translated: Next, the meaning of the term ‚Äúskill in destroying the continuity of the afflictions‚Äù should be explained.üîΩ‚ÄúSkill in destroying the continuity of the afflictions‚Äù refers to skill in destroying the latent impressions of the afflictions that remain on the grounds of realization that are distinguished by the perfections that have been taught as completing the bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life.

original: ba ji skad bstan pa de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag gzhig pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ba ji skad bstan pa de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag gzhig pa la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the term that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag la nyon mongs ba'i bag la nyal rnam pa du mchis lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag la nyon mongs ba'i bag la nyal rnam pa du mchis lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: the bodhisattva asked, ‚ÄúBhagavat, how many types of latent afflictions are there?‚Äù

original: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni grogs yang dag par bcom pa dang / bag la nyal stobs chung ba dang / bag la nyal phra mo'o //üîΩde la grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni grogs yang dag par bcom pa dang / bag la nyal stobs chung ba dang / bag la nyal phra mo'o // de la grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: 3. those that are subtle in terms of their latent state.üîΩThe first type of latent state of affliction is that which is destroyed by the antidote.

original: sa dang po nas sa lnga pa man chad la @17b nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa ni /üîΩsa de dag nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba yod pa de'i grogs lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de yang dag par bcom pas nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba'i grogs lhan cig skyes pa ma
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa lnga pa man chad la @17b nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa ni / sa de dag nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba yod pa de'i grogs lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de yang dag par bcom pas nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba'i grogs lhan cig skyes pa ma
translated: From the first stage up to the fifth stage, the latent states of affliction that existüîΩare not the innate ones.üîΩSince the antidote that is not innate has destroyed the innate ones that are not innate, the innate ones that are not innate do not occur.

original: yin pa yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir bag la nyal de lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang ni mi ldan la /
analyzed: yin pa yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir bag la nyal de lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang ni mi ldan la /
translated: Since the antidote that is not innate has destroyed the innate ones that are not innate, the latent states of affliction that are not innate do not occur.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba grogs yang dag par bcom pa dang ni ldan pas na grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba grogs yang dag par bcom pa dang ni ldan pas na grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe complete destruction of the companion‚Äù because it is endowed with the complete destruction of the companion, the innate afflictions.

original: dngos su na grogs yang dag par bcom pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bar mi bya'i /
