original: grangs med pa gsum pas ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pas mngon par 'du bya ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas gnas pa mchog thob ste /
analyzed: grangs med pa gsum pas ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pas mngon par 'du bya ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas gnas pa mchog thob ste /
translated: By the third countless eon, he attains the supreme state, having transcended the state of the perfect knowledges through abiding in signlessness, without exertion and spontaneously.

original: de yang nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: And that is certain.

original: de yang bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum gyis gnas pa bcu gcig thob pa de la yang brtson 'grus chen po'i yang chen pos sbyor bar byed pa de'i nang nas la las ni bskal pa bar ma mang po zhig 'dums par byed do //
analyzed: de yang bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum gyis gnas pa bcu gcig thob pa de la yang brtson 'grus chen po'i yang chen pos sbyor bar byed pa de'i nang nas la las ni bskal pa bar ma mang po zhig 'dums par byed do //
translated: He attains the eleventh state by three countless eons, and he applies himself with the greatest of great effort. Some reduce many intermediate eons,

original: la la ni bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos zhes bya ba bskal pa chen po gcig gam gnyis sam mang po dag gi bar du 'dums par byed mod kyang grangs med pa mang po shos 'dums par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med par rig par bya'o
analyzed: la la ni bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos zhes bya ba bskal pa chen po gcig gam gnyis sam mang po dag gi bar du 'dums par byed mod kyang grangs med pa mang po shos 'dums par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med par rig par bya'o
translated: but some reduce the least countless eon, which is one, two or many great eons. But it should be understood that none reduce the greatest countless eon.

original: // de ltar gnas pa 'thob pa'i tshul bstan pa de gnas ngan len spong ba'i tshul yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // de ltar gnas pa 'thob pa'i tshul bstan pa de gnas ngan len spong ba'i tshul yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The method of attaining the state of abiding should be understood as the method of abandoning the negative tendencies.

original: dus tshigs dang zla ba dang zla ba byed dang zhag dang nyi ma dang thun dang thun phyed dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang bskal pa grangs med pa dag gis spong ngo zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos dang
analyzed: dus tshigs dang zla ba dang zla ba byed dang zhag dang nyi ma dang thun dang thun phyed dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang bskal pa grangs med pa dag gis spong ngo zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos dang
translated: One abandons through seasons, months, fortnights, days, days and nights, periods, half-periods, moments, seconds, minutes, and countless eons.

original: sbyar te gdul bya bsam pa tha dad pa dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir sgra tha dad pas bstan to //
analyzed: sbyar te gdul bya bsam pa tha dad pa dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir sgra tha dad pas bstan to //
translated: This is applied to the fewest countless eons. It is taught with different terms for the sake of understanding for those to be trained with different intentions.

original: de yang sngar bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos ni gsum kho nas spong par bstan to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos ni gsum kho nas spong par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, it was previously taught that the most countless eons are abandoned by just three.

original: 'dir bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos ni dpag tu med pa dag gis spong bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dir bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos ni dpag tu med pa dag gis spong bar ston to //
translated: Here, the fewest countless eons are taught to be abandoned by countless [eons].

original: 'dir bskal pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dus kyi ming yin pas dus tshigs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir bskal pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dus kyi ming yin pas dus tshigs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, the term eon is a name for time, so it is said from seasons up to countless eons.

original: yud tsam dang bskal pa zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad la skabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yud tsam dang bskal pa zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad la skabs zhes bya'o //
translated: All the periods of time, from a moment up to an eon, are called occasions.

original: bskal pa de lta bu du dag gis dang po sems bskyed pa nas gnas pa mchog thob par gyur ba'i bar gyis gnas pa bcu gcig thob cing de dag gi gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa de lta bu du dag gis dang po sems bskyed pa nas gnas pa mchog thob par gyur ba'i bar gyis gnas pa bcu gcig thob cing de dag gi gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By how many eons does one go from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the attainment of the supreme state?

original: dpag tu med pa dag gis de dus tshigs btsan par bya na yang dus tshigs dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dag gis de dus tshigs btsan par bya na yang dus tshigs dpag tu med pas so //
translated: By countless eons, for the periods of time are countless.

original: zla ba phyed btsan par bya na yang zla ba phyed dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: zla ba phyed btsan par bya na yang zla ba phyed dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If one counts by half-months, the half-months are countless.

original: zhag pa tsan par bya na yang zhag dpag tu med pas so //üîΩnyi ma btsan par bya na yang nyi ma dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: zhag pa tsan par bya na yang zhag dpag tu med pas so // nyi ma btsan par bya na yang nyi ma dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If one counts by days, the days are countless.üîΩIf one counts by sun-motes floating in a sunbeam, the sun-motes are countless.

original: thun btsan par bya na yang @21b thun dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: thun btsan par bya na yang @21b thun dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If one counts by watches of the day and night, the watches are countless.

original: thun phyed btsan par bya na yang thun phyed dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: thun phyed btsan par bya na yang thun phyed dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If one counts by half-watches, the half-watches are countless.

original: skad cig btsan par bya na yang skad cig dpag tu med pas so //üîΩthang cig btsan par bya na yang thang cig dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: skad cig btsan par bya na yang skad cig dpag tu med pas so // thang cig btsan par bya na yang thang cig dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If he is to be powerful for an instant, he is so for an immeasurable instant.

original: yud tsam btsan par bya na yang yud tsam dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: yud tsam btsan par bya na yang yud tsam dpag tu med pas so //
translated: If he is to be powerful for a short time, he is so for an immeasurable short time.üîΩIf he is to be powerful for a moment, he is so for an immeasurable moment.

original: bskal pa btsan par bya na yang bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis so zhes de dag re re la yang dpag tu med pa'i sgra re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bskal pa btsan par bya na yang bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis so zhes de dag re re la yang dpag tu med pa'i sgra re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: If he is to be powerful for an eon, he is so for an immeasurable eon.üîΩHow long is an immeasurable eon?

original: de dag gi dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba'i yun yang dus ji tsam zhig la rtag ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba'i yun yang dus ji tsam zhig la rtag ce na /
translated: It is the length of time required to empty a granary

original: dus tshigs la sogs pa de dag gang yang rung ste /üîΩdpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni yun ni sngar bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum pa de'i yun dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: dus tshigs la sogs pa de dag gang yang rung ste / dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni yun ni sngar bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum pa de'i yun dang mnyam ste /
translated: by removing a single grain of corn every one hundred years.üîΩAn immeasurable eon is the length of time required to empty a granary

original: dus tshigs la sogs pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: dus tshigs la sogs pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: by removing a single grain of corn every one hundred years.

original: nam zhig na bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum thal bar gyur ba de na dus tshigs la sogs pa dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba yang mthar thug par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: nam zhig na bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum thal bar gyur ba de na dus tshigs la sogs pa dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba yang mthar thug par rig par bya ste ;
translated: When the three great eons are completed, then the immeasurable time of the eons, etc., should be understood as having ended.

original: mdor bsdus na bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum dang bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos dpag tu med pa zhes bya bar lung bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum dang bskal pa grangs med pa nyung du shos dpag tu med pa zhes bya bar lung bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, the three great eons are explained as the many great eons and the immeasurable eons are explained as the few great eons.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad thob cing gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad thob cing gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: Thus, the attainment and abandonment of all the bodhisattva stages and all negative tendencies is explained in terms of three great eons.

original: de lta yin pa las 'dir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sam dus tshigs dang zla ba dang zla ba phyed dang / zhag dang nyi ma dang thun dang thun phyed dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis spong ngo zhes bya bas bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum dang nyung du shos dpag tu med pa dag gis
analyzed: de lta yin pa las 'dir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sam dus tshigs dang zla ba dang zla ba phyed dang / zhag dang nyi ma dang thun dang thun phyed dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis spong ngo zhes bya bas bskal pa grangs med pa mang po shos gsum dang nyung du shos dpag tu med pa dag gis
translated: Thus, in this context, they are abandoned by three countless eons or by countless eons, which are longer than the longest and shorter than the shortest.

original: so zhes bstan pa ni gdul ba'i skye bo'i bsam pa dang / dbang po tha dad pa dag la go bar bya ba'i grangs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: so zhes bstan pa ni gdul ba'i skye bo'i bsam pa dang / dbang po tha dad pa dag la go bar bya ba'i grangs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching that they are abandoned by three countless eons or by countless eons, which are longer than the longest and shorter than the shortest, is a teaching of the number of eons required for disciples of different dispositions and faculties to understand.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa de dag re re la yun ji tsam gyis 'thob cing gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa de dag re re la yun ji tsam gyis 'thob cing gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur zhe na /

original: gnas pa re re la yang bskal pa bye ba 'bum phrag du ma 'am yang na de bas kyang ches mang bas 'thob cing gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bla ma'i khyad par bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa rnams kyis nges par bstan pa'i gzhungüîΩdag snang ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa re re la yang bskal pa bye ba 'bum phrag du ma 'am yang na de bas kyang ches mang bas 'thob cing gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bla ma'i khyad par bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa rnams kyis nges par bstan pa'i gzhung dag snang ngo //
translated: This is the authoritative statement of the great beings, the gurus.

original: de bas na dus tshigs @22a * //
analyzed: de bas na dus tshigs @22a * //
translated: Therefore, in one season,

original: gcig gam zla ba phyed dam zhag gcig gam nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: gcig gam zla ba phyed dam zhag gcig gam nyi ma gcig gam /
translated: one half-month, one day, one night,

original: thun gcig gam thun phyed dam skad cig gcig gam /üîΩthang cig gcig gam /
analyzed: thun gcig gam thun phyed dam skad cig gcig gam / thang cig gcig gam /
translated: one session, one half-session, one instant,

original: yud tsam gcig gam bskal pa gcig gis gnas pa thob cing gnas dan len spong ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yud tsam gcig gam bskal pa gcig gis gnas pa thob cing gnas dan len spong ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: one moment, one period, or one eon, they attain and abide in the stages and abandon the negative tendencies.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa'i khyad par re re'i yon tan yang bskal pa grangs med pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du brjod kyang mthar phyin par sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa'i khyad par re re'i yon tan yang bskal pa grangs med pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du brjod kyang mthar phyin par sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the qualities of each of the bodhisattvas‚Äô distinctive stages cannot be easily completed even if one were to speak of them for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang lags /
translated: The Blessed One, what are the characteristics of the arising of afflictions for bodhisattvas?

original: skyon ni gang lags yon tan ni gang lags par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa yan chad kyis de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni so so
analyzed: skyon ni gang lags yon tan ni gang lags par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa yan chad kyis de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni so so
translated: What are their faults? What are their virtues? and so on, it shows that the afflictions of bodhisattvas, as they have been explained, are virtues for those who have entered the stage of pure superior intention, but faults for others.

original: skye bo sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas sred pa 'gog pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba phan yon chen po dang ldan pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: skye bo sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas sred pa 'gog pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba phan yon chen po dang ldan pa yin par ston to //
translated: It shows that they have great benefits, outshining the roots of virtue of ordinary beings who follow craving, and of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas who stop craving.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rjes su mi 'brang bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rjes su mi 'brang bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of being without affliction means that because they do not follow craving, they do not come under the power of affliction.

original: de'i phyir sa dang po la so sor nges pa kho nar chos kyi dbyings thams cad rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa dang po la so sor nges pa kho nar chos kyi dbyings thams cad rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúon the first stage, one realizes the entire basic element of the Dharma, just as it is, and so forth.

original: rang gi rgyud la sdug bsngal skyed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med pa yin no zhes bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la sdug bsngal skyed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med pa yin no zhes bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is faultless because it is incapable of producing suffering in one‚Äôs own continuum, because it is the cause of ripening one‚Äôs own qualities of a Buddha.

original: sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal rnam par bzlog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yon tan dpag tu med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal rnam par bzlog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yon tan dpag tu med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable goodness because it is the cause of averting suffering in the realm of sentient beings, because it is the cause of ripening sentient beings.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'og nas byang chub ces 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'og nas byang chub ces 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú In which‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúenlightenment‚Äù below.

original: sems can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams de tsam du zil gyis gnon par bgyid na zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rjes su mi 'brang ba dang sred pa 'gog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams de tsam du zil gyis gnon par bgyid na zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rjes su mi 'brang ba dang sred pa 'gog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they surpass the wholesome roots of all sentient beings, of all ≈õrƒÅvakas, and of all pratyekabuddhas is because they do not follow craving and do not stop craving.

original: byang chub ji tsam du don che ba ni ngo mtshar lags so zhes bya ba ni tshogs dpag tu med pas byang chub pa'i sgo nas yon @22b tan de lta bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ji tsam du don che ba ni ngo mtshar lags so zhes bya ba ni tshogs dpag tu med pas byang chub pa'i sgo nas yon @22b tan de lta bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase how great is the benefit of enlightenment! is because such qualities are attained through enlightenment by means of immeasurable collections.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'dzin pa gzhig pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the skill in destroying the continuity of the afflictions has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu nges par 'byin pa'i bye brag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu nges par 'byin pa'i bye brag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the skill in the distinctions of definite emergence should be explained.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i bye brag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa'i khyad par la mkhas pa'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i bye brag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa'i khyad par la mkhas pa'i don 'dir bstan pa'o // de'i phyir bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The phrase skill in the classification of the vehicles means skill in the distinction of vehicles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bka' stsal to ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bka' stsal to ;
translated: Therefore, with reference to this, the Lord said, That which is the vehicle of the disciples and that which is the universal vehicle is the universal vehicle.

original: / de la dgongs pa gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so //üîΩngas nyan thos kyi theg par chos sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid /üîΩngas theg pa chen por chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig par bstan pa bshad de zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par ni chos kyi dbang du byas te bstan la /
analyzed: / de la dgongs pa gang lags zhes bya ba zhus so // ngas nyan thos kyi theg par chos sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid / ngas theg pa chen por chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig par bstan pa bshad de zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par ni chos kyi dbang du byas te bstan la /
translated: Here, the Lord is asked, What was the intention in that statement?üîΩ I have taught in the vehicle of the disciples that the various natures of things are the reality realm.üîΩ I have taught in the universal vehicle that the reality realm is of one mode.

original: theg pa chen por ni chos nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: theg pa chen por ni chos nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: In the vehicle of the disciples, the reality realm is taught in terms of the various natures of things.üîΩIn the universal vehicle, the reality realm is taught in terms of the nature of things.

original: bstan pa chos dang chos nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir nga ni theg pa tha dad par mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan pa chos dang chos nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir nga ni theg pa tha dad par mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the teaching, the Dharma, and reality are not different, I do not teach different vehicles.

original: de la gang dag don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar rnam par rtog pa kha cig ni sgro 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yod par rtogs pa gang dag theg pa gsum gtan par tha dad par smra ba dag go
analyzed: de la gang dag don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar rnam par rtog pa kha cig ni sgro 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yod par rtogs pa gang dag theg pa gsum gtan par tha dad par smra ba dag go
translated: Among them, some who imagine the meaning to be just as it is in the words, ‚Äúsome superimpose‚Äù are those who conceive of existence by the characteristics of form and so on and who say that the three vehicles are definitely different.

original: // kha cig ni skur pa 'debs par byed cing zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes smra ba de mtshan nyid thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa gang dag theg pa gcig tu yang gtan med par smra bdag go //
analyzed: // kha cig ni skur pa 'debs par byed cing zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes smra ba de mtshan nyid thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa gang dag theg pa gcig tu yang gtan med par smra bdag go //
translated: Some denigrate, saying, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are essenceless,‚Äù are those who denigrate all characteristics and who say that even the one vehicle does not exist at all.

original: de gnyis mi mthun par sems shing phan tshun rtsod par zad de zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du mar tha dad pa de gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis mi mthun par sems shing phan tshun rtsod par zad de zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du mar tha dad pa de gnyis so //

analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

analyzed: gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa dang 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa dang 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of the transformation is the reality of the Dharma Body, which is the attainment of the non-erroneous suchness and the unchangeability of the correct intuition.

original: de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po bstan to //

original: byang chub kyi dngos po de ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi dngos po de ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /

original: ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pas so //

original: de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /

analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi 'jug pa'i gnas ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'jug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: shes bya legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras du ni gnas gyur pa de shes bya'i de kho na legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of thorough analysis of objects of knowledge is the result of thoroughly analyzing the suchness of objects of knowledge.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnas gyur pa de mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings @25a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnas gyur pa de mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings @25a * //
translated: The characteristic of the purity of the expanse of reality is the transformation of the basis because it is the basis of the supremacy over all signs.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mthu gang zhe na /

analyzed: mdor bsdu na stobs bcu dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dbang bcu la mthu zhes bya'o //

original: thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang zhe na /

translated: In brief, means should be understood as the four forms of attracting other beings.üîΩWhat is the knowledge of aspirational prayers?üîΩIn brief, it should be understood as the knowledge of the fulfillment of one's own and others' aims.

analyzed: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa ste /
translated: For those to be trained by the Sravakas, he emanates as a Sravaka; for those to be trained by the Pratyekabuddhas, he emanates as a Pratyekabuddha;üîΩand for those to be trained by the Buddhas, he emanates as a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni phyogs bcur sprul pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag la thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni phyogs bcur sprul pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag la thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //

original: 'jug pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: mi rtag par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas rab tu phye ba yin par rtog @25b pa'o ;

original: gnas gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang mi byed la /

analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang rgyu gnyis kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i chos kyi sku de yang rgyu gnyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu gnyis kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i chos kyi sku de yang rgyu gnyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan te /
translated: The dharmakƒÅya, which is distinguished by transformation, is taught to have the characteristic of the inconceivable through two causes.

translated: Since the meaning of the inexpressible is beyond the domain of words, therefore it is inconceivable. Since it is beyond the world, it is without worldly examples. analyzed: de yang spros pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba med pa yin te /

translated: ƒÄryadeva‚Äôs Praise of the DharmakƒÅya says:

analyzed: gcig min du ma ma yin bdag dang gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur la /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thos pa yongs su tshol bas thos pa'i dngos por rig pa'i gnas lnga po de dag btsal na mkhas par bya ba sna tshogs dag bye brag tu gtogs par 'gyur ba de ni bye brag tu rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva's search for the five branches of learning as objects of hearing is the teaching of specific realization, since it leads to the various kinds of expertise.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni khas len pa bstan te /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni khas len pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase the object of going for refuge indicates the teaching of acceptance.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar khas len pas ni gnas lnga po lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje che ba dang /

translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva's acceptance of going for refuge in the three jewels is the purification of three actions: the purification of physical action, the purification of verbal action, and the purification of mental action.

analyzed: ji tsam gyis na skyabs su song ba yin / skyabs su song bas ni ji ltar bsgrub par bya ste /

analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni gang zhe na /

original: skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go //

analyzed: rgyu bzhis na de dag nyid la skyabs su 'gro ba ste / sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni shin tu dul ba'i bdag nyid yin la rnam pa thams cad du gdul bya @36a * //
translated: One goes for refuge in them for four reasons:

original: 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / thugs rje che ba dang / zang zing gi mchod pa thams cad kyis mnyes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / thugs rje che ba dang / zang zing gi mchod pa thams cad kyis mnyes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: The Buddha Jewel is the one who has the nature of being completely tamed, who is skilled in the means of taming all those to be tamed, who has great compassion, who is not pleased by any material offerings, and who is pleased by the offering of practice.

original: de lta bus bstan pa'i chos dkon mchog dang / de'i gsung las skyes pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang rnam pa de lta bu kho nas skyabs su 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus bstan pa'i chos dkon mchog dang / de'i gsung las skyes pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang rnam pa de lta bu kho nas skyabs su 'os pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma Jewel and the Sa·πÖgha Jewel taught by such a one are also worthy of being refuges in just that way.

original: rgyu bzhis na skyabs su song ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis na skyabs su song ba yin te /
translated: One becomes a person who has gone for refuge through four causes:

analyzed: yon tan shes pa dang / khyad par shes pa dang / khas blangs pa dang / skyabs gzhan mi smra bas so //

analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The correct practice of going for refuge is fourfold:

translated: relying well on holy persons, listening to the holy Dharma, properly paying attention, and practicing the Dharma in accordance with what one has heard.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, the correct practice is fourfold:

original: dbang po mi rgod par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blang bar bya ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje bar bya ba dang / dus dus su dkon mchog mchod pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po mi rgod par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blang bar bya ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje bar bya ba dang / dus dus su dkon mchog mchod pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should not let the senses run wild, one should take up the bases of training, one should have compassion for sentient beings, and from time to time one should strive to make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni bzhi ste /

analyzed: bsod nams rgya chen po thob pa dang / dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / rnam par dag pa thob pa'o //
translated: one obtains vast merit, one obtains vast joy and supreme joy, one obtains concentration, and one obtains purification.

original: gzhan yang phan yon bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang phan yon bzhi ste /

original: bsrung ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / log par mos pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsrabs pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su rtogs pa thob pa dang / dam pa yang dag par song ba skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi nang du bgrang bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bsrung ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / log par mos pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsrabs pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su rtogs pa thob pa dang / dam pa yang dag par song ba skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi nang du bgrang bar gyur pa dang /
translated: one possesses great protection, all obscurations of wrong belief are reduced, completely exhausted, and completely understood, and one is counted among the holy beings who have attained the highest.

original: ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang bstan pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang bstan pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is pleasing and delightful to the Teacher, to those who practice the same way of life, and to the gods who have faith in the teaching.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni skyabs su gzhan khas mi len par dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar khas len pa'i phyir des ni khas len pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni skyabs su gzhan khas mi len par dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar khas len pa'i phyir des ni khas len pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva's going for refuge to the Three Jewels is shown by his not accepting any other refuge and by his accepting the Three Jewels as his refuge.

original: bslab pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni sgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni sgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase the points of training shows his practice.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the practice of all bodhisattvas, whatever they are training in, however they are training, and wherever they are training, is called the bodhisattva practice.

original: de nyid bslab pa'i dngos po yang yin sgrub pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bslab pa'i dngos po yang yin sgrub pa'ang yin no //
translated: That is the point of training and the practice.

original: de la byang chub @36b sems dpa' rnams gang la slob ce na /
analyzed: de la byang chub @36b sems dpa' rnams gang la slob ce na /
translated: What do the bodhisattvas train in?

original: gnas bdun la slob ste /
analyzed: gnas bdun la slob ste /
translated: They train in seven subjects.

original: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob pa'o //
translated: the benefit of self, the benefit of others, the benefit of the absolute, power, the development of living beings, the development of one's own qualities of Buddhahood, and the practice of supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: de la bdag gi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag gi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of self?

original: rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: It is of ten kinds:

original: 'ba' zhig pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel ba dang / phan pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rgyur bsdus pa dang / 'bras bur bsdus pa dang / tshe 'di pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel ba dang / phan pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rgyur bsdus pa dang / 'bras bur bsdus pa dang / tshe 'di pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: the benefit of self alone, the benefit of self and others, the benefit of others alone, the benefit of this life, the benefit of future lives, the benefit of both this life and future lives, the benefit of worldly dharmas, the benefit of transcendental dharmas, the benefit of the conditioned, and the benefit of the unconditioned.

analyzed: gzhan gyi don gang zhe na /

analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu ste /

translated: the ten benefits of self are applied to the benefit of others.

original: de kho na'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of the absolute?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of reality:üîΩthe reality of the way things are,üîΩand the reality of the full extent of things.

analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid gang yin pa dang ; ji snyed yod pa nyid las brtsams te /

analyzed: chos rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa nyid dang thams cad nyid ni chos rnams kyi de kho na'i don mtha' dag yin par rig par bya'o //

original: de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na dang / rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / shes bya'i sgrub pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na'o //

translated: the reality of what is renowned in the world, the reality of what is renowned through reasoning, the reality that is the domain of the wisdom that is purified of the obscurations of affliction, and the reality that is the domain of the wisdom that is purified of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de dag las dang po gnyis ni tha ma'o //

original: gsum pa ni 'bring /

original: bzhi pa ni mchog yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mchog yin par rig par bya'o ;

original: / mthu gang zhe na /
analyzed: / mthu gang zhe na /

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu dang / thun mong gi mthu dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu dang / thun mong gi mthu dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mthu'o //

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba gang zhe na /

original: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug ste /

original: ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the essence, the person to be fully accomplished, the classification of full accomplishment, the means of full accomplishment, the person who is being fully accomplished, and the characteristics of the person who fully accomplishes.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the full accomplishment of one‚Äôs own Buddha qualities?

analyzed: ste ; sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs su bstan pa drug po de dag nyid rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya bar sbyar ba yin no //
translated: These very six teachings are applied to the maturation of one's own Buddha qualities as the means to bring about the maturation of sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang zhe na /

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / dam par gyur pa dang / yon tan dang ; 'byung ba dang / khyad par gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood through its nature, its supremacy, its qualities, its emergence, and its distinction.

original: de las ngo bo nyid ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / che ba nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de las ngo bo nyid ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / che ba nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'o //

translated: The ‚Äúsublime‚Äù is the seven kinds of sublime states: sublime body, sublime practice, sublime fulfillment, sublime intuition, sublime power, sublime abandonment, and sublime dwelling.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ;
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ;
translated: The ‚Äúqualities‚Äù are those of a Tathagata, a Saint, genuinely and fully awake, with clear vision and proper mind, sublime,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /üîΩbla na med pa /

analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //

original: 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gnyis mi 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du don mdzad pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad na sangs rgyas 'byung ba srid pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gnyis mi 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du don mdzad pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad na sangs rgyas 'byung ba srid pa la sogs pa'o //

original: khyad par ni sangs rgyas thams cad khyad par bzhi po sku tshe dang / mtshan dang / gdung dang / gzugs kyi sku ma gtogs par thams cad mtshungs par mnyam ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni sangs rgyas thams cad khyad par bzhi po sku tshe dang / mtshan dang / gdung dang / gzugs kyi sku ma gtogs par thams cad mtshungs par mnyam ste /

original: khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'o //
translated: There is no difference in their qualities.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar slob ce na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar slob ce na /

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te mos pa mang bar bya ba dang / chos btsal bar bya ba dang / chos bstan par bya ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba dang / legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te mos pa mang bar bya ba dang / chos btsal bar bya ba dang / chos bstan par bya ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba dang / legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba dang /

analyzed: de la ji ltar mos pa mang bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i gnas dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / de kho na'i don dang / lam la gnas pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub dang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang /
translated: the topic to be explained, the qualities of the Three Jewels, the power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the meaning of thatness, abiding in the path, attaining the result, unsurpassed enlightenment, the bodhisattva trainings,

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos mdo'i sde la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye bas mos pa mang par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos mdo'i sde la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye bas mos pa mang par bya'o //
translated: and the well-spoken Dharma of the sutra section and so on. The element of interest in the bodhisattvas‚Äô Dharma of the buddhas is classified as having many kinds of interest, since it is the confidence that one is able to attain it.

original: ji ltar chos btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos btsal bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /

analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pas bsdus pa rig pa'i gnas lnga po nang gi rig pa dang /
translated: The five sciences are the inner science,

original: gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa dag tshol lo //
analyzed: gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa dag tshol lo //

original: ji ltar tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshol zhe na /

analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gsum gyis chos tshol te /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva searches for the Dharma in three ways:

analyzed: gus pa chen po nye bar gzhog pa dang / 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan pa phun sum tshogs pas so //

original: ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /
translated: For what purpose does one search?

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga bo de dag tshol ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshol lo //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga bo de dag tshol ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshol lo //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva seeks these five sciences in order to perfect the great accumulation of knowledge for unexcelled enlightenment.

original: ji ltar chos bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos bstan par bya zhe na /

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood in five ways:

original: ji ltar btsal ba dang ji ltar gzung ba'i chos de dag nyid lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / legs par sems pa dang / legs par bsgom pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang @38a * //
analyzed: ji ltar btsal ba dang ji ltar gzung ba'i chos de dag nyid lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / legs par sems pa dang / legs par bsgom pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang @38a * //
translated: The Dharma that is sought and held is accomplished by the bodhisattva with body, speech, and mind, well thought out, well cultivated, and well penetrated by discernment.

original: dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba de dag yongs su spang ba dang / gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du gnang ba de dag la so sor brten par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba de dag yongs su spang ba dang / gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du gnang ba de dag la so sor brten par byed pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva abandons those dharmas that the Lord has not permitted to be done with body, speech, and mind, and he resorts to those that he has permitted.

original: ji ltar legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhe na /
