original: gdams ngag ni mdor bsdu na rnam par brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag ni mdor bsdu na rnam par brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, instruction should be understood as eightfold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang la 'dams par mdzad pa de la dang por sems btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang la 'dams par mdzad pa de la dang por sems btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: The bodhisattva and the Tathagata first seek and know the thought of the person to be instructed.

original: sems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: Having sought the thought, they seek and know the faculties.

original: sems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to //üîΩdbang po btsal nas bsam pa btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to // dbang po btsal nas bsam pa btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: Having sought the mind, he seeks the faculties and knows them.üîΩHaving sought the faculties, he seeks the thoughts and knows them.

original: bsam pa btsal nas bag la nyal btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: bsam pa btsal nas bag la nyal btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: Having sought the thoughts, he seeks the proclivities and knows them.

original: bag la nyal btsal nas ci rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba ba'i dmigs pa la 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: bag la nyal btsal nas ci rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba ba'i dmigs pa la 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: Having sought the proclivities, he introduces them to the object of meditation that purifies the conduct that is the door of entry that is appropriate for them.

original: ci rigs par 'jug pa'i sgor btsud nas legs par ma zin pa rtag par lta ba'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ci rigs par 'jug pa'i sgor btsud nas legs par ma zin pa rtag par lta ba'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
translated: Having introduced them to the door of entry that is appropriate for them, he teaches them the middle way as the antidote to the view of eternalism that is not well-taken up.

original: de nas legs par ma zin pa khyad par lta ba'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas legs par ma zin pa khyad par lta ba'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
translated: Then he teaches them the middle way as the antidote to the extreme view of annihilation that is not well-taken up.

original: de nas ma byas pa dang / ma thob pa dang / ma reg pa dang / mngon sum du ma khyab pa la mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ma byas pa dang / ma thob pa dang / ma reg pa dang / mngon sum du ma khyab pa la mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Then he causes them to abandon the conceit that thinks, ‚ÄúI will actualize what has not been done, not obtained, not touched, and not actualized.‚Äù

original: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
translated: These eight instructions are to be known as being summarized in three topics.

original: sems mi gnas pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir thog mar dmigs pa la legs par gtong ba'i gnas dang / sems gnas pa la rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par bstan pa'i gnas dang / rang gi don thob pa mthar phyin pa bar ma do'i gnas 'dor du 'jug pa'i gnas kyis te /
analyzed: sems mi gnas pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir thog mar dmigs pa la legs par gtong ba'i gnas dang / sems gnas pa la rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par bstan pa'i gnas dang / rang gi don thob pa mthar phyin pa bar ma do'i gnas 'dor du 'jug pa'i gnas kyis te /
translated: The first topic is the instruction on the proper focus of attention in order to stabilize the unstable mind. The second topic is the instruction on the path of means in order to attain one's goal when the mind is stabilized. The third topic is the instruction on the relinquishment of the intermediate state in order to perfect the attainment of one's goal.

original: de la gdams ngag dang po lnga ni gnas dang por bsdus so //
analyzed: de la gdams ngag dang po lnga ni gnas dang por bsdus so //
translated: The first five instructions are included in the first topic.

original: bar ma gnyis ni gnas gnyis par bsdus so //
analyzed: bar ma gnyis ni gnas gnyis par bsdus so //
translated: The two middle instructions are included in the second topic.

original: tha ma ni gnas tha mar bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni gnas tha mar bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The last instruction is to be known as being included in the third topic.

original: rjes su bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is instruction?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as being of five kinds.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun du spyod pa dgag pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa kun du spyod pa gnang ba dang / dgag pa dang gnang ba'i chos rnams la 'khrul par kun du spyod pa bskul ba dang /üîΩyang dang yang du gus par gyur te @38b 'khrul pa la rnyog pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / snum pa'i bsam pa sma dbab pas brtan par byed du gzhug pa dang yang dag par zhugs pa la dgag pa dang /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun du spyod pa dgag pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa kun du spyod pa gnang ba dang / dgag pa dang gnang ba'i chos rnams la 'khrul par kun du spyod pa bskul ba dang / yang dang yang du gus par gyur te @38b 'khrul pa la rnyog pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / snum pa'i bsam pa sma dbab pas brtan par byed du gzhug pa dang yang dag par zhugs pa la dgag pa dang /
translated: It is to prevent the practice of what is blameworthy, to allow the practice of what is not blameworthy, and to encourage the practice of what is not confused with regard to the rules of what is prohibited and what is permitted.

original: gnang ba'i chos rnams kyi yon tan yang dag pa dang dgag pa bsnyad pas yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnang ba'i chos rnams kyi yon tan yang dag pa dang dgag pa bsnyad pas yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: It is to cause one to be stable through the attitude of respect, the absence of confusion, the absence of contradiction, and the attitude of humility, and to cause one to be delighted through the explanation of the qualities of the rules of what is prohibited and what is permitted.

original: rjes su bstan pa lnga po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dgag pa dang / gnang ba dang / bskul ba dang / sma dbab pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa lnga po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dgag pa dang / gnang ba dang / bskul ba dang / sma dbab pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: These five kinds of instruction are, in brief, prohibition, permission, encouragement, humility, and delight.

original: ji ltar legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan pa la gnas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par gdams shing rjes su bstan pa la gnas par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one abide in the precepts and instructions?

original: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad dang rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga po ji skad bstan pas gzhan la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba de dag nyid kyang legs par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad dang rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga po ji skad bstan pas gzhan la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba de dag nyid kyang legs par gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should abide in the eight precepts and the five instructions, as they have been taught, which are to be given to others as precepts and instructions.

original: ji ltar thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las can bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las can bya zhe na /
translated: How should one have actions of body, speech, and mind which are fully embraced by means?

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang / dkon mchog mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang / dkon mchog mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: One should have the six perfections, the four means of conversion, worship of the Three Jewels, reliance on spiritual friends, cultivation of the immeasurables,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpas thams cad slob pa'i las can du bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpas thams cad slob pa'i las can du bya'o //
translated: cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, and all the bodhisattva practices fully embraced by the means of the four persuasions.

original: de la gang dag slob ce na /
analyzed: de la gang dag slob ce na /
translated: What is it that one should practice?

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bcu po dag slob par byed de /üîΩrigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / res par zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bcu po dag slob par byed de / rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / res par zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa dang /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva trains in ten aspects.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma'o //
translated: He abides in the spiritual gene, enters the resolve stage, has impure resolve, has pure resolve, is not fully matured, is fully matured, has not entered the stage of nonregression, has entered the stage of nonregression, is impeded by only one birth, and is in his final existence.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas la sems ma bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas la sems ma bskyed pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the spiritual gene means to abide in the spiritual gene of the bodhisattva, to have not yet produced the thought of awakening.

original: zhugs pa'i rigs la gnas pa de nyid slob slob pa na sems skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i rigs la gnas pa de nyid slob slob pa na sems skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Having entered the resolve stage means to abide in the spiritual gene, to have entered the resolve stage, and to have produced the thought of awakening.

original: bsam pa ma dag pa ni zhugs pa de nyid ji srid du bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ma dag pa ni zhugs pa de nyid ji srid du bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having impure resolve means to have entered the resolve stage, but not yet to have entered the stage of pure superior attitude.

original: bsam pa dag pa ni de nyid bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa ni de nyid bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having pure resolve means to have entered the stage of pure superior attitude.

original: yongs su ma smin pa ni bsam pa dag pa de nyid ji srid du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sal ma zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa ni bsam pa dag pa de nyid ji srid du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sal ma zhugs pa'o //
translated: The unripened is that very pure intention which has not yet entered into the stage of culmination.

original: yongs su smin pa ni de nyid mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa @39a * //üîΩla zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni de nyid mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa @39a * // la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The ripened is that very pure intention which has entered into the stage of culmination.

original: yongs su smin pa nges par zhugs pa ma yin pa ni yongs su smin pa de nyid ji srid du nges pa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa nges par zhugs pa ma yin pa ni yongs su smin pa de nyid ji srid du nges pa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa'o //
translated: The ripened which has not definitely entered is that very ripened which has not yet entered the stage of definite entrance and the stage of definite practice.

original: nges par zhugs pa ni de nyid nges pa dang spyod pa nges pa'i sa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa ni de nyid nges pa dang spyod pa nges pa'i sa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The definitely entered is that very ripened which has entered the stage of definite entrance and the stage of definite practice.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni tshe phyi ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni tshe phyi ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is obstructed by one birth is the one who will fully awaken to unsurpassed, true, and complete enlightenment in the next life.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i tshe 'di nyid la gnas bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i tshe 'di nyid la gnas bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who, while still in this very life, attains the supreme enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: de ltar gang la slob pa dang ; ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gang la slob pa dang ; ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the training, the one who trains, and all the trainings are included in the bodhisattva's practice.

original: de nyid la bslab pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir des ni sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid la bslab pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir des ni sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The word object indicates the practice.

original: byang chub kyi dngos po zhes bya bas ni mthar thug pa bstan no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi dngos po zhes bya bas ni mthar thug pa bstan no //
translated: The word enlightenment indicates the culmination.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The supreme enlightenment of perfect buddhahood should be understood in five ways:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pas so //
translated: by its nature, its power, its method, its engagement, and its disengagement.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin te /
translated: Their classifications have already been explained in the section on the excellence of the result.

original: de ni gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni mthar thug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni mthar thug pa bstan to //
translated: Since the characteristic of the Dharma Body, which is the perfect establishment of the transformation of the basis, is the ultimate, it is taught as the ultimate.

original: de la ci'i phyir thos pa dang skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa dang byang chub kyi dngos po de bzhi tshoms gcig tu mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir thos pa dang skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa dang byang chub kyi dngos po de bzhi tshoms gcig tu mdzad ce na /
translated: Why are those four things listening, going for refuge, training, and enlightenment all put together in one group?

original: de tsam gyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because everything is included in just that.

original: thos pas bye brag tu rtogs pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba khas blangs pa dang / bslab pas bslabs pa dang / byang chub kyi mthar thug par bstan pa'i rim pa des chos 'di pa'i dngos po sems bskyed pa nas tha mar 'bras bu mchog thob pa'i bar thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pas bye brag tu rtogs pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba khas blangs pa dang / bslab pas bslabs pa dang / byang chub kyi mthar thug par bstan pa'i rim pa des chos 'di pa'i dngos po sems bskyed pa nas tha mar 'bras bu mchog thob pa'i bar thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Listening is the understanding of the distinctions, going for refuge is the commitment, training is the training, and enlightenment is the ultimate. By that process, everything is included in this Dharma, from the generation of the thought of enlightenment up to the attainment of the supreme result in the end.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po dgu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po dgu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the nine things that follow after that?

original: sems can du gdags pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams bstan te /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe entities that are designated as sentient beings‚Äù indicates the aggregates.

original: de la phung po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de la phung po ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five of them:

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the compositional factor aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
translated: Their presentation is indicated by six topics:

original: ngo @39b bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten gyis so //
analyzed: ngo @39b bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten gyis so //
translated: their nature, their meaning, their classification, their sequence, their inclusion, and their basis.

original: de la phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the aggregates?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The nature of the form aggregate is established as being elevenfold:

original: mig la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the ten sense fields from the eye sense field to the tangible object sense field, plus the form that is included in the sense field of mental objects.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
translated: In brief, it is the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: All of it has the characteristic of being suitable as form.

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the definition of the aggregate of feeling?

original: de ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: feeling that arises from the contact of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental organ.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, it is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: It is also twofold:

original: lus kyi dang / sems kyi ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dang / sems kyi ste /
translated: bodily and mental.

original: gzugs can la brten pa ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs can la brten pa ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Bodily feeling is based on the material sense faculties.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa la brten pa ni sems kyi ste thams cad dang myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa la brten pa ni sems kyi ste thams cad dang myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Mental feeling is based on the nonmaterial sense faculties. All of it has the characteristic of being experienced.üîΩWhat is the definition of the aggregate of conception?

original: 'du shes kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the aggregate of perception?

original: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is sixfold:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang ; lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang ; lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: perception arising from contact with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental organ.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is also sixfold:

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: small, large, immeasurable, infinite, with a sign, and signless.

original: de la chung du ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de la chung du ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'o //
translated: Small is that of the realm of desire.

original: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i 'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i 'o //
translated: Large is that of the realm of form.

original: tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na spyod pa'o 'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na spyod pa'o 'o //
translated: Immeasurable is that of the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na spyod pa'i ste /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na spyod pa'i ste /
translated: Infinite is that of the sphere of nothingness.

original: de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: All these are with a sign.üîΩSignless is that of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'o //
translated: The signless is the summit of existence and the supramundane, which are the training and the beyond training.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These are in brief of two kinds:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ste /
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: thams cad kyang kun shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kun shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: All of them have the characteristic of causing understanding.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe @40a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe @40a * //
translated: What is the definition of the aggregate of formations?

original: na ; de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: na ; de yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa'o //
translated: the intention that arises from the contact of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body and mental organ.

original: de yang yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It has the characteristic of causing the mind to act in conformity with the object and to approach it.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gan zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gan zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the aggregate of consciousness?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: It is of eight kinds:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: the store-consciousness, the defiled mind, and the six consciousnesses.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, it is threefold:

original: myong ba'i dbye ba dang / dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i dbye ba dang / dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: the division of experience, the division of the apprehension of signs in the objective, and the division of states.

original: de la myong ba'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la myong ba'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The division of experience is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The division of the apprehension of signs in the objective is sixfold:

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur ba dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur ba dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: small, large, immeasurable, nothing whatsoever, with signs, and signless.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The division of states is threefold:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: dbye ba de dag gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbye ba de dag gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: When these divisions are combined, there are eighteen types.

original: thams cad kyang dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: All of them have the characteristic of the awareness of an object.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the nature of the aggregates.

original: de la phung po rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the meaning of the aggregates?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: nges pa'i tshig dang / dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang / dgos pa'o //
translated: the verbal definition and the purpose.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig ni /
translated: What is the verbal definition?

original: ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called aggregates?

original: phung po'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is taught.

original: de yang dus dang / rgyu dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir bsdu ba dang / bsdus pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dus dang / rgyu dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir bsdu ba dang / bsdus pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: It is an accumulation because it is a collection of forms, etc., that are different in terms of time, cause, liberation, and object.

original: de la gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever form there is,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang gi dang / phyi rol gyi dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang gi dang / phyi rol gyi dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang /
translated: past, future, and present, internal and external, gross and subtle, inferior and superior, far and near,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar yang de bzhin te /
translated: and so on up to: feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: de la 'das pa dang @40b ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang zhes bya bas ni dus tha dad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang @40b ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang zhes bya bas ni dus tha dad pa bstan to //
translated: Here, ‚Äúpast, future, and present‚Äù indicates the difference in time.

original: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa bstan to //üîΩrags pa dang phra ba zhes bya ba sa ni rnam pa tha dad pa bstan to //üîΩngan pa dang bzang po zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa bstan to // rags pa dang phra ba zhes bya ba sa ni rnam pa tha dad pa bstan to // ngan pa dang bzang po zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúInternal and external‚Äù indicates the difference in continuum.üîΩ‚ÄúGross and subtle‚Äù indicates the difference in type.

original: 'gro ba tha dad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba tha dad pa bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúInferior and superior‚Äù indicates the difference in realm.

original: thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba zhes bya bas ni yul tha dad pa bstan te /
analyzed: thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba zhes bya bas ni yul tha dad pa bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúFar and near‚Äù indicates the difference in object.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pas ni rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pas ni rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'am /
translated: Since they are all included in one, they are included because they include all aspects.

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap‚Äù because all aspects are included in the aggregates.

original: dgos pa ci'i phyir na phung po rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci'i phyir na phung po rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of positing the aggregates?

original: phung po rnam par gzhag pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po rnam par gzhag pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The purpose of positing the aggregates is taught.

original: phung po de dag ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po yin pa'i phyir 'du byed tsam ste /
analyzed: phung po de dag ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po yin pa'i phyir 'du byed tsam ste /
translated: The aggregates are mere conditioning forces because they are many and various in nature.

original: de las don gzhan pa'i bdag med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las don gzhan pa'i bdag med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The aggregates are posited in order to demonstrate that there is no self that is a real entity separate from them.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the meaning of the aggregates.

original: de la phung ba rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung ba rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the classification of the aggregates?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The presentation of the classification of the aggregate of form is sixfold.

original: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / mi dben pa dang / 'du shes kyi spyod yul dang mtha'o //üîΩde la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / mi dben pa dang / 'du shes kyi spyod yul dang mtha'o // de la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: the differentiation of entities, the differentiation of characteristics, the differentiation of the abodes and non-abodes of consciousness, the differentiation of the isolation and non-isolation of consciousness, the differentiation of the domain of ideation, and the differentiation of the extremes of ideation.

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of entities: whatever is form is all included in the four great elements and in what is derived from the four great elements.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The differentiation of characteristics: the specific and the general characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na dad pa dang dang ba'i dang ba dang / yid kyis bzung ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na dad pa dang dang ba'i dang ba dang / yid kyis bzung ba'i gzugs so //
translated: The specific characteristic of form is, in brief, that which is resistant and that which is held to be form by the mind.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is that which is suitable as form.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni mi zad pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni mi zad pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The classification of consciousness as abiding or not abiding is as follows: That form which is not exhausted is called the ‚Äúabode of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rnams skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rnams skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is mixed with consciousness, that which is engaged in the sense of being the same as the self and pleasure, and that which is the condition for the arising of the feelings.

original: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni ma zin pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni ma zin pa ste /
translated: That which is the opposite of that is not grasped.

original: rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩrnam par shes pa las dben @41a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o // rnam par shes pa las dben @41a * //
translated: It should be understood that it is not the abode of consciousness.

original: pa dang ; mi dben pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa las mi dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa dang ; mi dben pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa las mi dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The classification of form as separated or not separated from consciousness is as follows: That form which is not separated from consciousness is called ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par don la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par don la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in the sense of being the same as consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The form that is separate from consciousness is called similar to that,

original: rang gi rgyud dang mtshungs par rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud dang mtshungs par rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the stream of consciousness.

original: 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'du shes gsum po 'di dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'du shes gsum po 'di dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The classification of the domain of perception is the three perceptions of form,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: the perception of form, the perception of obstruction, and the perception of variety.

original: gzugs kyang mtshan nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mtshan nyid gsum ste /
translated: Form also has three characteristics:

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dag kyang go rims bzhin du 'du shes gsum po dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dag kyang go rims bzhin du 'du shes gsum po dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: the characteristic of appearance, the characteristic of location, and the characteristic of expansion. These should be seen as the domain of the three perceptions, respectively.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzin par byed pa ni gzugs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzin par byed pa ni gzugs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: Among them, the perception of form is the grasping of color such as blue, etc.

original: 'gro ba thogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni thogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba thogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni thogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The notion of resistance is the notion of obstruction.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang khang khyim dang zhing la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang khang khyim dang zhing la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The notion of variety is the notion of the designation of male, female, house, field, etc.

original: mtha'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na gzugs kyi mtha' rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtha'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na gzugs kyi mtha' rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The limit of form is twofold:

original: khams 'og ma dang bar ma bar mar gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khams 'og ma dang bar ma bar mar gtogs pa ste /
translated: the lower limit and the upper limit.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: The lower limit is the realm of desire, and the upper limit is the realm of form.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of feeling?

original: de ni rnam pa lnga ste /üîΩdngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba dang / nye bar brtags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lnga ste / dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba dang / nye bar brtags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is fivefold:üîΩ1) as substance, 2) as characteristic, 3) as arising, 4) as investigation, and 5) as deliverance.

original: de la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni myong ba nyid dang / myong ba'i gnas dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni myong ba nyid dang / myong ba'i gnas dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: As substance, it is experience, the basis of experience, and the favorable factor of experience.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The classification of characteristics is the individual characteristic and the universal characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The individual characteristic is the individual nature of each feeling: the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, and the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The universal characteristic is the characteristic common to all feelings.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni mtshan nyid brgyud pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba @41b yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩgang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni mtshan nyid brgyud pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba @41b yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du mdzad nas / gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is suffering because of the characteristic of change. The feeling of pain is suffering because of the suffering of pain. The feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful is suffering because of the suffering of conditioned states.üîΩWith reference to this, the Buddha said:

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering here.

original: rab tu skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni reg pa bcu drug la tshor ba rnams rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni reg pa bcu drug la tshor ba rnams rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The classification of the arising of feeling is the arising of the feelings from the sixteen types of contact.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang ; sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang ; sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
translated: The six types of contact are contact through the coming together of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty, contact through the coming together of obstruction, contact through the coming together of designation, contact through the coming together that is conducive to the experience of pleasant feeling,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / khong khro ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / khong khro ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
translated: contact through the coming together that is conducive to the experience of painful feeling, contact through the coming together that is conducive to the experience of neither painful nor pleasant feeling, contact through the coming together of attachment, contact through the coming together of aversion,

original: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las so //
analyzed: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las so //
translated: contact through the coming together of ignorance, contact through the coming together of knowledge, and contact through the coming together of neither knowledge nor ignorance.

original: bcu drug po de dag kyang yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid la brten nas ni 'dus te reg pa drug po rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcu drug po de dag kyang yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid la brten nas ni 'dus te reg pa drug po rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: These sixteen are established on the basis of the grasping of objects, as the six contacts, and as the contact that impedes.

original: yul la rnam par rtog pa nyid la brten nas ni tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: yul la rnam par rtog pa nyid la brten nas ni tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: They are established on the basis of the discrimination of objects, as the contact that is the designation of names.

original: / yul myong bar byed pa nyid la brten nas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa gsum rnam par gzhag go //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / rig pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: / yul myong bar byed pa nyid la brten nas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa gsum rnam par gzhag go // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / rig pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are established on the basis of the experience of objects, as the three contacts that are favorable to the sensations of pleasure, etc.üîΩThey are established on the basis of defilement and purification, as the contacts that are attachment, hostility, confusion, knowledge, and neither-knowledge-nor-non-knowledge.

original: ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The analysis of contact is finished.üîΩThe analysis of sensation

original: nye bar brtags pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba nye bar brtags pa rnam par brgyad de /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba nye bar brtags pa rnam par brgyad de /
translated: There are eight kinds of sensation, according to the S≈´tra.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar brtags pa dang / tshe 'di la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de 'gog pa nye bar brtags pa dang ; tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de 'gog pa nye bar brtags pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar brtags pa dang / tshe 'di la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de 'gog pa nye bar brtags pa dang ; tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de 'gog pa nye bar brtags pa dang /
translated: The causes of suffering are investigated by investigating the causes of suffering that arise in this life, the causes of suffering that arise in the next life, the causes of suffering that arise from both, the causes of suffering that arise from neither, the causes of purification that arise from both and the causes of purification that arise from neither.üîΩThe results of suffering are investigated by investigating the results of suffering that arise in this life, the results of suffering that arise in the next life, the results of suffering that arise from both, the results of suffering that arise from neither, the results of purification that arise from both and the results of purification that arise from neither.üîΩThe cessation of suffering is investigated by investigating the cessation of suffering that arises in this life, the cessation of suffering that arises in the next life, the cessation of suffering that arises from both, the cessation of suffering that arises from neither, the cessation of purification that arises from both and the cessation of purification that arises from neither.

original: de gnyis ka las 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de gnyis ka las 'byung ba nye bar brtags pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar brtags pas so //üîΩde dag ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ka las 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtags pa dang / de gnyis ka las 'byung ba nye bar brtags pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar brtags pas so // de dag ni /
translated: The path to the cessation of suffering is investigated by investigating the path to the cessation of suffering that arises in this life, the path to the cessation of suffering that arises in the next life, the path to the cessation of suffering that arises from both, the path to the cessation of suffering that arises from neither, the path to the cessation of purification that arises from both and the path to the cessation of purification that arises from neither.

original: mdo las bcom @42a * //
analyzed: mdo las bcom @42a * //
translated: The S≈´tra Requested by ≈öƒÅriputra says:

original: ldan 'das nyag gcig dben par gshegs te /
analyzed: ldan 'das nyag gcig dben par gshegs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn went alone to a solitary place

original: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la bzhugs pa na thugs la thugs kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la bzhugs pa na thugs la thugs kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
translated: and while dwelling in meditative equipoise, this thought arose in his mind:üîΩWhat is feeling?

original: tshor ba ni gang /üîΩtshor ba kun 'byung ba ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gang / tshor ba kun 'byung ba ni gang /
translated: What is the origin of feeling?

original: tshor ba 'gog pa ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gog pa ni gang /
translated: What is the cessation of feeling?

original: tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
translated: What is the path that leads to the origin of feeling?

original: tshor ba'i ro myang ba ni gang /üîΩtshor ba'i nyes dmigs ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba'i ro myang ba ni gang / tshor ba'i nyes dmigs ni gang /
translated: What is the enjoyment of feeling?üîΩWhat is the danger in feeling?

original: tshor ba la nyes par 'byung ba ni gang snyam nas /
analyzed: tshor ba la nyes par 'byung ba ni gang snyam nas /
translated: What is the escape in feeling?

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought:

original: tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /üîΩbde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of feeling:

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: reg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ngo //
translated: Feeling arises from the arising of contact.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
translated: Feeling ceases through the cessation of contact.

original: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags shing gnas pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags shing gnas pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The path leading to the arising of feeling is the delight in feeling, the expression of delight in feeling, and the intense delight in feeling that is based on the expression of delight in feeling.

original: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / mngon par mi brjod pa dang / lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / mngon par mi brjod pa dang / lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The path leading to the cessation of feeling is the absence of delight in feeling, the absence of expression of delight in feeling, and the absence of intense delight in feeling that is based on the absence of expression of delight in feeling.

original: tshor ba la brten te bde ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i ro myong ba yin no ;
analyzed: tshor ba la brten te bde ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i ro myong ba yin no ;
translated: The experience of the taste of feeling is the arising of pleasure and mental joy that is based on feeling.

original: / tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: / tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: The disadvantage of feeling is that feeling is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: tshor ba la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no snyam mo zhes gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no snyam mo zhes gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The renunciation of feeling is the subduing of the passion of craving for feeling, the abandoning of the passion of craving for feeling, and the complete transcendence of the passion of craving for feeling.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba'i dbang po lnga las nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba'i dbang po lnga las nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The five faculties of feeling are the renunciation of the five faculties of feeling.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The renunciation of the faculty of mental dissatisfaction is the first meditative absorption.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second meditation is the renunciation of the faculty of pain.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
translated: The third meditation is the renunciation of the faculty of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is the renunciation of the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The sphere of the infinity of space is the renunciation of the faculty of indifference.

original: @42b de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: @42b de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of conception?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: 1) as substance, 2) as characteristic, 3) as error, 4) as non-error, and 5) as discernment.

original: de la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni dmigs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ni dmigs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: As substance, it consists of the apprehension of the sign of the object and of the factors favorable to its persistence.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: As characteristic, it consists of the specific and the general characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The specific characteristics are of six kinds:

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med par sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta par bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med par sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta par bya'o //
translated: small, large, immeasurable, nothing at all, with signs, and signless, as previously explained.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kun shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kun shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is the characteristic of the faculty of understanding all.

original: phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa mi mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa mi mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
translated: The classification of error is the childish, the unskilled, the wise, the improper mental attention,

original: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the apprehension of signs in regard to impermanent objects as permanent, in regard to suffering as happiness, in regard to the impure as pure, and in regard to the insubstantial as substantial.

original: de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
translated: This is the error of ideation.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log de yang khyim pa rnams la ni sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log de yang khyim pa rnams la ni sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, this error of ideation becomes the error of mind in the case of householders,üîΩbut the error of view in the case of those gone forth.

original: rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa dag la ni lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa dag la ni lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: For those outside this ordination, the views are distorted.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dngos po bzhi po de dag la log par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dngos po bzhi po de dag la log par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
translated: Another explanation: The distorted perception of those four things is the distortion of perception.

original: yul de la de ltar kun du shes pa'i kun du 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de ni sems phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: yul de la de ltar kun du shes pa'i kun du 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de ni sems phyin ci log yin no //
translated: The attachment to those objects, which is the complete understanding of them, is the distortion of mind.

original: phyin ci log gi dngos po de nyid la de ltar kun du shes shing lhag par chags pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi dngos po de nyid la de ltar kun du shes shing lhag par chags pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba phyin ci log yin no //
translated: The complete understanding of those distorted things, the attachment to them, the manifestation of them, the desire for them, the teaching of them, and the establishment of them is the distortion of view.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdzangs pa mkhas par rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdzangs pa mkhas par rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa /
translated: The classification of the undistorted is the wise, the learned, the knowledgeable, and the one who attends properly.

original: dmigs pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa la mi sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag med do zhes yang dag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa la mi sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag med do zhes yang dag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the correct apprehension of the sign of impermanence, of suffering, of impurity, and of selflessness, in regard to what is impermanent, suffering, impure, and selfless.

original: de ni de'i 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: This is the non-erroneous perception, thought, and view of that person.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The analysis of determination is fivefold:

original: @43a * // yul yongs su gcod pa dang / myong ba yongs su gcod pa dang / brda yongs su gcod pa dang / log par yongs su gcod pa dang / bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: @43a * // yul yongs su gcod pa dang / myong ba yongs su gcod pa dang / brda yongs su gcod pa dang / log par yongs su gcod pa dang / bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: determination of the object, determination of experience, determination of conventional expressions, determination of error, and determination of the meaning of reality.

original: de la yul yongs su gcod pa ni yul la mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yul yongs su gcod pa ni yul la mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Among these, the determination of the object is the apprehension of the object as a sign and a symbol.

original: myong ba yongs su gcod pa ni yul la nges par 'byung ba'i tshor ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba yongs su gcod pa ni yul la nges par 'byung ba'i tshor ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The determination of experience is the apprehension of the feeling of certainty in regard to the object.

original: brda yongs su gcod pa ni bdag gam gzhan dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: brda yongs su gcod pa ni bdag gam gzhan dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The determination of conventional expressions is the apprehension of the name, clan, and so on, of oneself or others.

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The type is the class to which the person belongs.

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'dzin pa'o //üîΩlog par yongs su gcod pa ni yul phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'dzin pa'o // log par yongs su gcod pa ni yul phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The family is the clan to which the person belongs.üîΩThe erroneous determination is the determination of the object in a manner contrary to reality.

original: bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa ni yul la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa ni yul la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The true determination is the determination of the object in a manner that is not contrary to reality.

original: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of formations?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: yul dang / gnas skabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang / gnas skabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: 1) classification according to domain, 2) classification according to state, 3) classification according to defilement, 4) classification according to purification, and 5) classification according to activity.

original: de la yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni sems pa'i tshogs drug po rnams 'du byed du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni sems pa'i tshogs drug po rnams 'du byed du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the classification according to domain is the establishment of the six groups of volition as formations.

original: gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The classification according to state is the establishment of the formations that are not associated with the mind, such as birth, old age, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'du byed kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'du byed kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The classification of defilement is the presentation of the defilement of the motivating dispositions and the secondary defilements.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The classification of purification is the presentation of the factors of purification such as faith.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The classification of instigation is fivefold.

original: yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par bya ba dang / de dang 'bral bar bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kun du bslab par bya ba dang / sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par bya ba dang / de dang 'bral bar bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kun du bslab par bya ba dang / sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As previously indicated, the instigation of mind should be understood as fivefold: for the sake of the concordance with the object, for the sake of the attainment of that, for the sake of the separation from that, for the sake of the purification of the motivating dispositions, and for the sake of the mastery of mind.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of consciousness?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: kun nas zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnas dang / gnas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: kun nas zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnas dang / gnas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: 1) clinging, 2) defilement, 3) basis, 4) abiding, and 5) variety.

original: de la kun du zhen @43b pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod pa can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa la gzugs la kun du zhen pa kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun du zhen @43b pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod pa can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa la gzugs la kun du zhen pa kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the classification of clinging is as follows: In the desire realm, the consciousness of those who are desirous is called ‚Äúclinging to form‚Äù because it is attached to external forms.

original: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen la la sa de gnyi ga la kun du zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen la la sa de gnyi ga la kun du zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the form realm, the consciousness of the pure gods is called ‚Äúclinging to both‚Äù because it is attached to internal name-and-form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming la mngon par zhen pa la ming la kun du zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming la mngon par zhen pa la ming la kun du zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the formless realm, the consciousness of formless sentient beings is called ‚Äúaddicted to names‚Äù because it is addicted to the internal name.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgo gnyis nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgo gnyis nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The classification of defilement: the consciousness of fools is defiled in two ways.

original: tshe 'di la yul la yongs su spyod pa'i sgo dang / tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yul la yongs su spyod pa'i sgo dang / tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is defiled by the enjoyment of objects in this life, and it is defiled by the suffering of birth, old age, etc., in the next life.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ; sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa lta bur 'dzin pas tshod ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu bstan to //

translated: The aggregate of perception is taught next to that because it is like vegetables, since it grasps pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings as being like friends, enemies, and neutral persons, respectively.
